description:
Love Dave & the environment he created. The kids the doggies all can come hang out. The best bar in town. Mars Bar is the bomb. Can hang out for happy hour. You want regret it !!

Ramon
author: Ramon M.

description:
Randomly stopped by Mars Bar before our dinner in the same neighborhood. The staff here is very friendly and were able to take our orders quickly. There was live music on a Sunday afternoon, though it was extremely loud, even the bartenders were saying it was too loud.

Not the most updated bar, but it is small and quaint, definitely a bar I would only visit if I was in the area and couldn't visit another. Everyone else seemed to be enjoying themselves though, which does make the vibe more fun!
author: Lillian B.

description:
We visited for lunch and got drinks and food. The drinks had a heavy pour(amazing!) and were delicious and given to us very prompt. For food we started with the Wings, and for the entree got burgers, Caesar salad and Asian steak salad. Be warned: The wings don't come with blue cheese. It's a blue cheese ranch mixture. The wings themselves were still very tasty. The burgers had a nice char on the edges and were cooked to perfection. The Asian salad was SO tasty and will absolutely be the reason we return here. 

They have an indoor and outdoor seating. Today was warm but the outdoor seating looks like it is heated. The ambiance is excellent and nice for a low key lunch/dinner.
author: Allison G.

description: They say men are from Mars but this raises the bar for all genders. I had a great salmon sandwich with fries. The service was great. This bar is a mix of locals and techies which is a hybrid of my make up. I like coming here in the day and night time.
author: Juan V.

description:
I was at a friend's place down the street and since the sun was out we wanted an outdoor area to hang out without going too far. Mar's checked all the boxes. I've never been here but noticed how big their outdoor patio is! I mean it wraps around the bar and they have a ton of seating. They have an outdoor bar that opens at night normally and the one inside is large enough to grab a drink without waiting long. Prices are a bit more than a normal bar but this place had a dance area with a DJ going that day so I can understand the increase in drink prices. Fun spot to hang out  with friends and apparently it's crackin at night. I'll have to check that out sometime. They also serve food but I can't comment on that since we didn't order anything. 

Laid back spot that's not pretentious or yuppyish.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Rating is for lunch. They had a pretty good menu, but nothing was really that well done. I had a grilled turkey and cheese, and my partner at a salad. They serve romaine lettuce despite the ongoing E coli warnings. I found that odd. Not really bad, but nothing exceptional

Romaine Lettuce E. Coli Cases Climb: What You Need to Know - Consumer Reports


https://www.consumerreports.org/e-coli/romaine-lettuce-e-coli-cases-climb-what-you-need-to-know/

dan barzel 901-213-7131
author: Dan B.

description:
This is a quaint bar/ restaurant. I ordered a burger and fries. Very very large burger . So you better be hungry when you come here. DELICIOUS.They have many other items on the menu that looks yummy.
I came during the week day evening. Busy but the bartender was very nice and payed attention to our every need.They have a very cool outdoor patio area.Nice old school bar. VERY clean and comfortable atmosphere.Parking can be challenging. But well worth the effort to come here and enjoy yourself.
So next time you come to the SF area make sure you stop in here . You won't be disappointed.
CHEERS‼‼
author: Eric A.

description:
We have been here a dozen times since only moving into the neighborhood about 2 months ago. It is one of the best local bars around. They make great drinks and have great food. Love their outside patio. It is an amazing spot for groups. Going by here after work is a must if you live in the area. 

The owner, Keith, who I had only met once helped me out when I needed to use a printer was great and very helpful. Not many businesses will do that nowadays. Which just goes to show how good the service extends beyond all expectations.
author: Casey B.

description:
I"m rating this based on my experience which was mid afternoon on a workday in the late spring.  

Its a place in the sunny part of SF with amble outdoor space. During the afternoon on a Thursday it wasn't crowded. I came by myself to do some work on their WIFI and grab a beer, but there were a few groups in the courtyard drinking, eating, and chatting. This is the perfect place for this.

I didn't order a meal here so I can't comment on the food quality too much. However, I did order some garlic fries expecting them to be mediocre, and they are amazing. Probably some of the best garlic fries I have had in SF. I can't say if their other food is good, but its a good sign.
author: Andrew B.

description:
Laid back bar with bar bites and pool table.  

There's outdoor seating as well to bathe in the sun, if weather permits.

Corner spot and pretty happening place during the happy hour times!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Been here 2x now. First time staff was rude. Second time they said they weren't open despite the website and storefront saying otherwise. We won't bother again.
author: Disco B.

description: Good food (pulled pork and tater tots), good service, good music and good ambiance (the folks next to us we're having a full on conversation in French). Reminded me of being back in France. We will be back so that I can have a drink or two.
author: Jonathon J.

description:
Just an OK local watering hole. The food can sometimes surprise you, for bar food. Their nachos and fries are great for sharing and they have some weekly lunch specials like Taco Tuesdays. The drink selection is typical, though the bartenders can be slow at times, but there's a nice outdoor patio to make up for it.

Overall, never a place I'd go out of my way for, but if you're in the neighborhood, fine for a drink, and if you're already drinking here, might as well get some greasy food.
author: Gonzalo S.

description: I had a previous review and am updating it out of respect to the owner who reached out to me personally to apologise for my experience. I visited and had an unpleasant experience with service But the bar itself was a ton of fun and had a nice atmosphere. The drinks were good and pool table is only $1. I would recommend for a chill night at the bar with some friends.
author: Elisa D.

description:
I've been a Mars customer for well over five years now. Whether you're looking for a quick bite or a round of drinks you can't go wrong with Mars. Arrive early to avoid the usual lunch and happy hour crowd. Patio seating fills up quickly and is most popular during warm spring/summer months. There's always a menu special and surprisingly the food is pretty solid. My go to is the cheeseburger with swiss cheese. Definitely the best hamburger in the neighborhood. I know, pretty bold statement. 

Expect an after work crowd on Friday's. This is a regular spot for employees of various companies up and down the street(mine included). Hide your work badge and throw back a couple cold ones.
author: Ralph A.

description:
We wanted to grab a quick snack and drinks before attending an art show at SOMArts, so found this spot within walking distance. We grabbed a seat at the bar and ordered the Garlic Fries ($7) and Calamari ($10) to snack on. Both were tasty and exactly what I was craving. The fries were standard with only a hint of garlic flavor, but their special chipotle aioli sauce was bomb! The calamari was quite yummy with perfectly crisp and huge pieces.

Since we were at the bar, the bartender was quick to attend to our service and refilling our drinks the minute we finished them. We went through 3 rounds plus a shot. I have to say that the mixed drinks weren't too heavy though.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
Came here a few weeks ago and had a wonderful time. This bar isn't that big, and it gets really crowded during the weekend. However, isn't that where the fun is? You come hang out with your friends because you want to feel you are still connected to people, not isolated. At here, you get to meet a lot of cool people. The drinks here are great too. Just order a drink, talk whatever you want, and have a good time. 

Can't recommend this place more.
author: Alton W.

description: Cozy place! So many businesses around, and so perfect for an after the clock beverage or bar food. They have a good selection of craft beers on tap with a good happy hour. Dollar off beers, wine, and cocktails I believe the hours are 4-7 but I could be wrong. I didn't order any food here but the guy next to me was munching away and I could smell his food and that smell was very delicious.
author: Laura C.

description:
Mars is kinda like the Cheers of SoMa. A spot that is always full of regulars, the staff knows your name and you don't even have to order because they already know "the usual."  A great little pub with comfy booths, outdoor seating and a decent selection of craft beer on tap.  I have never eaten here but the food looks reasonably priced and offerings include standard bar fare like nachos, buffalo wings, pizza and burgers.

A good crowd of young professionals given the mix of start ups and companies like Pinterest, Air BnB and Zynga in the area.  Happy hour is daily until 7PM and that includes $1 off drafts as well as some food specials.  Great service, comfortable atmosphere and can accommodate a large group of friends or an intimate date.
author: Kelsey B.

description: With a few changes, I think this place could be great. It's centrally located in SoMa near a lot of businesses and has $1 off beer at happy hour, making it a decent spot to grab a drink with friends after work. However, it needs to decide between being a music/dancing place and a chat with friends place. It has the set up of a place intended to grab a drink with friends but the music is insanely loud, so you have to shout to have a conversation. After being in there for an hour or two, my throat was seriously sore from talking so loud. Also, the beer selection needs to be expanded. Any place where I ask for a stout and all they have is Guinness has room for improvement in my book. Overall, pretty good for a drink after work, but with all of the great bars in SF, not my first pick.
author: Audrey S.

description: Great outdoor space for a party of any size! Especially enjoyed our server, Kelly! She was fun and attentive. Great experience; can't wait to go back on another weekend day!
author: Clyde V.

description:
My meal of choice at Mars Bar is their Chicken Sandwich. It sounds simple but it's delicious.
Its grilled chicken, with apples, brie and greens, serviced with fries or salad. Every time it's just so darn tasty! So few places understand how amazing apples and cheese are on sandwiches, so whenever I find a place like this, I can't help but go back! The atmosphere is really chill, and the staff is friendly! It's perfect for an after work hangout with their outdoor patio, or a quick lunch bite!
author: Larissa S.

description: The chic bartender was clueless. Her service was awful and she got our easy order wrong. She was super rude. It was as if we were troubling her. That alone will make it tough to come back.
author: Josh G.

description: I came by for a beer before a show at the great northern and within 5 min the bartender lost my card.  She not only lost my card she gave me another persons card.  Terrible experience with good music and decently priced drinks. Be carful about running a tab unless you want to spend your weekend trying to correct the issues of an incompetent waitress.
author: Michael J.

description: Mars is a fantastic place, run by great owners and staff. I found myself going here often as a party hang out on Sunday afternoons, the music is usually house music on Sundays and you will find a great group of friendly faces there, dancing, eating, watching sports and enjoying the outside areas, you can tell that crowd is a great combination of music lovers and party people who know how to have a good time. I have been there on other days and nights too, to eat and watch sports, the food is decent enough pub food and the beers are delicious. I also love the staff, super nice bartenders and waiters every time I go. The outside patio deck is great for weekends.
author: James D.

description: Interesting place to stumble into on a Sunday afternoon. Happened to be close. Food was pretty tasty bar fare - we tried their pizza and tots. Feel like we entered a trancy dance zone with some very nice folks who may have still been there since last night? Dance music loud and um...persistent. Not a bad experience just giving a heads up. Chill place.
author: Pamela B.

description:
This place is always relaxing and unpretentious, granted I've only been here a couple of times. 

Beers are fine, food is meh. But the atmosphere is really cool. Good music, nice people. Great bar for after work.
author: Avery D.

description:
Super nice and cool space, amazing staff and great food!
Wether if you're by yourself or with friends, Mars Bar is always the right place to go!
I've been to Mars Bar so many times, always a good time!
Highly recommended!
author: Hai C.

description:
Very happy sitting at the bar for a quick drink and appy. Menu looks good! Guy next to me says Pulled pork is thumbs up. I tell him, it's one of my favorite foods so really tell me.. How's the sauce, usually too bland. He says it's good. Fries look decent too - may be house cut cuz they have skin on. 
Now, I ordered wings with the bartenders recommendation: order with Cajun spice rub and wing sauce and blue cheese on the side. Da bomb
author: amy j.

description:
Mars Bar is part bar, part restaurant. Both parts are pretty good.

Food is fresh enough - ask for their specials each day. Their penne is made fresh, while their fried chicken tends to make the rounds on other days. Also, make sure to grab a Restaurant.com coupon to save some $$.
author: Casey S.

description:
I came here with a group of friends for both business and leisure, and this turned out to be the perfect place to have a casual group meeting with good food and beer. I like the variety of food on their menu. Simple yet high quality. We decided on French Fries with Chipotle Aioli Sauce, Margarita Pizza, and Buffalo Wings. SO GOOD!! The food is fresh, the beer is cold, and the service is friendly. What more could you want?

After visiting the Mars Bar website, I learned that there are 1/2 price Buffalo Wings and $3 Bottled Beer Mondays!! Definitely coming back for that. I also love the vibe of this restaurant. Feels kinda divey with the TVs and neon lights, but the food and service exceeded my expectations for that type of atmosphere. Again, great choice for casual hangouts!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Within the first few minutes of arriving to Mars Bar, I see a girl twerking on top of someone's dog and then she proceeds to go to the corner of the table to throw up.  Eventually she gets kicked out but not after the waitress was more then understanding of how much fun Mars Bar can be! 

I came here for an event with the homies, and got the bottomless mimosas. I think I got about a good 8 full servings of straight champagne out of it. I guess they ran out of OJ at a certain point. The back bar area with the stage was a perfect place to throw a party and get your dance on.  I would say this is a good place for day time events, and all you can drink mimosas! Would definitely stop by here for another event.
author: Gary Royale T.

description:
They say good things happen to good people. Well how about people who are just regular? I like to think I'm not that bad. My thoughts of rage on the smelly, crowded bus are really just thoughts anyway. Well folks, I'm here to tell you that good things DO happen to good, bad, regular, in between, you name their lot in life, good things can happen to them.

On the first day of jury duty, my dear friend gave to me... one gin and tonic! That's right, my friend bought me a drink. But wait, there's more! He happened to be going to the Giant's game that evening and, donned in his Giant's t-shirt, the kindly bartender asked if we needed some extra tickets as his boss couldn't make the game. Super stoked at the option of getting myself to one of maybe a handful of games this season, I gladly accepted said tickets, free of charge. 

Bias due to this happy come-up aside, Mars is pretty cool. I didn't eat this time around since Senior Sisig was making an appearance by the ballpark, so ya know, but the gin and tonic was one of the best I've had, and that's saying something. Outdoor patio area, lots of TVs, cool glazed wood tables, awesome artwork, great bar tending staff. I went back in yesterday evening after a long day of jury duty in need of a stiff drink, and my favored bartender was there! He gave me a much appreciated heavy-handed shot of Fernet (thank you!!). I'll surely be back.
author: Crystal C.

description:
If I could give zero stars, I would.

Today, my friends and I decided to stop by Mars to grab a bite.  We sat down around 12:10pm and put in our order pretty soon after.  We received our waters pretty quickly, but that's where the service ended.  It wasn't until 1:00pm (50 minutes later..) our waitress told us she would check on our food for us.  50 minutes had gone by and not once did the waitress check in with us.  At 1:00pm, I had to leave to get back to work, and she tells us our order was misplaced.  We told her to forget the order and left as we did not want to spend a penny in this establishment after that had happened.

Horrible horrible service.  Just awful.  I will not be coming back.
author: Scott H.

description: Such a fun place! We were instantly welcomed upon walking in the door. The staff was so kind to us, making sure that we had everything we needed. Their outdoor seating area is lovely. On chillier days they turn on the heating lamps, which makes for a lovely place to enjoy a meal! Their guacamole and pico is delicious, and they give you a decent amount of chips! On Tuesday's they have $2 carnitas tacos! If you like your carnitas pretty juicy and tender this is a great deal! They run rotating specials throughout the week. Would highly recommend to anyone in the area!
author: Amberly V.

description: Cool little no frills bar with a dance area and an outdoor patio. Not a bad place to laze on a Sunday late afternoon.
author: Andrew K.

description:
(This review is only for the lunch service.)
The food itself isn't bad: good bar food and nice portions. The issues are -- it's always super loud in there (I went on a Sunday midday and you couldn't even hear yourself think). That decibel level may be appropriate for a late night or after a ball game, but not for a Sunday at 1:00pm. Also, I've had a couple of coworkers go there to pick up a to-go order and it's either wrong or their order was nowhere to be found because the ticket was misplaced or the kitchen never got it.
author: Carlo A.

description:
The food was very tasty. I got a good ole fashion cheese burger with garlic fries. I was very happy. I ordered medium rare and the beef was cooked correctly! Don't you hate it when the burger joints give you a well done cardboard pattie? My lady got the steak sandwhich and she had no complaints. I would have rated the place four stars but I knocked a star due to its service. This is the second time I have been here... The service was poor the first time as well. Just expect the poor service if you decide to dine here and you will be happy. 

Why was it bad? Well, no greeting or anything. We sat at the outside patio (very nice and spacious) for a few minutes before I decided to get up and ask the redhead at the bar for two menus. Her facial expression was classic! She gave me the look like I was bothering her. Keep in mind there was maybe one or two people at the bar and one other couple outside. 

We decided what we were going to order and made the proactive decision to order the food at the bar (don't expect that lady to take your order). When asked if an order could be placed at the bar, the redhead gave a half-nod with a stale gaze. So I waited several minutes until the order was taken. We grabbed our own water (request returned with a slight frown) and sat down. She brought the food with the "I'm not happy to be here attitude," but whatever. They forgot my cheese but it was remedied. 

Even on the way out... We asked to close the tab and got the same look when I asked for the menus! Maybe this lady was having a bad day... But this place has good-ole American food but piss poor service.
author: Wil L.

description: Just held my birthday here and had a great time! I had about 25 people come and we sat on the patio during a beautiful Saturday afternoon. They allowed my friend to DJ so we had some great music, too. Would highly recommend.
author: Maria S.

description: Love the atmosphere, nice solid bar, good table layout. Tried the pulled pork sandwich and loved it.
author: Collin T.

description:
I got some great tips about Portland from one of the bartenders here.

The place is down in not-exactly-an-empty-stretch of Soma but you'll probably have other reasons to be in this area besides coming here. In other words, I don't think it's a destination spot.

Nevertheless, the place has a hug patio and I can see this place getting full on a beautiful weekend afternoon so maybe I'll give it a try then.
author: Art O.

description: Basic, slightly-divey, pub-like bar. Great if you live or work nearby but not too much reason to visit otherwise. Could be much worse, of course. And the outdoor seating out back is nice on a good day.
author: Abhishek G.

description:
Mars Bar is your typical dive bar with outdoor patio and bites to keep you drinking.  Not a bad thing whatsoever, just stating the obvious.  The staff seems pretty hard core, barely breaking face or cracking a smile but their service is good every time.  I have not had a chance to have their food but everyone around me seemed to be enjoying the edibles.

I think the patio is probably the best part about this space. Large space heaters to keep you warm in the wee hours of daylight, along with a serene fountain to keep you calm while pounding back margaritas.  The space offers numerous tables with a "private" back area and separate bar for those busy days/nights.

Take a little trip to Mars and you'll be flying high after just one drink.
author: Kevin J.

description:
A bar deep in Soma with a patio for sunny days. Mars Bar is a nice place to spend a lazy weekend afternoon in the sun if you're in the area.

We stopped in one Saturday afternoon for a couple of beers and were pleasantly surprised to discover the patio. (Not that it was shabby on the inside.) It was a mixed crowd outside. Hipsters, techies, new moms with their moms, and us... all coexisting within the same space. 

We ordered the New Margarita pizza (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mars-bar-and-restaurant-san-francisco?select=ETbBcZB7gDvMoKr7wH0Tog#ETbBcZB7gDvMoKr7wH0Tog) to accompany our beers and I must admit, I like their take on the old classic. Instead of the traditional mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil you have ricotta, sun dried tomato, and pesto. A smart play and the flavors worked really well together. The crust was crispy but the middle couldn't hold up against the toppings but such a minor point - We just flipped the ends in and it was delicious. 

The location either works for you or it doesn't. There isn't much around so if you're looking for a drinks/grub, Mars it is. Probably not going to be a destination spot but we were more than happy to have stumbled on Mars Bar & Restaurant.
author: Jon L.

description:
I attended a birthday party at Mars Bar over the weekend. On a sunny Sunday, we found ourselves in the city relaxing on the patio. The Birthday Boy was on deck, so the music was great.

I saw the Lemonade on the corner of the bar and craved a Bourbon Lemonade Cocktail over ice with a little spritz. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/0FU4AMHgNcElMtoXg0Li6Q?select=GOJ7PEUE-9CuJ6_Ynaouyg

We were kinda hungry so we ordered the burger to split and an appetizer, since they offer up the good toppings, I added BRIE. Yep, amazing. The burger was so good, juicy and cooked perfectly. Served with good fries and all the toppings. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/0FU4AMHgNcElMtoXg0Li6Q?select=Nl-bdcvQcX3Lphp_RKe4Ow

For our appetizer, we had the chicken satay type skewers. They were good but the burger was the star, for sure. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/0FU4AMHgNcElMtoXg0Li6Q?select=RG5epJJC2dzz0L9G0jrBMQ

The birthday party was great, we all seemed to have a great time whether you were watching the game (GO GIANTS!), playing pool or basking in our summer sun, it was a good day in the city.
author: Rebekah T.

description: We just recently held a birthday party for my fiancé here for about 25 people. It was a very large group and on a Sunday so the place was pretty packed! I have to admit though the staff and owner of Mars definitely did a great job in accommodating us! Their service was great, and everyone had an amazing time. We all had the bottomless mimosas and the waitress was so good about always keeping us topped off. I would definitely recommended this place to anyone in SF for a great brunch spot! Thank you for the wonderful time you showed us and for working with us on such short notice!! F
author: Alisha K.

description: The lunch special is a good deal. We had the $2 carnitas tacos which were very good and nicely seasoned. The meat was nice and tender. It comes with a side of tortilla chips but no salsa which would have been nice. We also had the Asian steak salad which was nicely done. The only thing is that we asked for medium rare steak and it was medium done. It still tasted good and was not tough but we wished it was medium rare as we requested. The service was quick and friendly. We chose to sit in the outdoor patio garden. I would eat here again if I am in the area.
author: Lucy L.

description: Went a week and a half ago to "Fried Chicken 'N Funk" on a Saturday afternoon. Great outdoor space. Loved the DJ, perfect volume. Might have wanted my Jack and Diet to be even cheaper than the $8, b/c I had 3 of them and didn't feel a thing (I'm not a big guy, 150#). Cool they had food, I was hungry. Fried chicken, yes! I was anticipating dare I say, KFC style, well, fried chicken. Ok, so they were wings. There was an order, pick your sauce, with a small side, or you could get an order with each of the three sides. Guess how much the latter was. Go ahead. Ready: $20. That's before tip. I ended up paying $24 for 1/2 dozen wings, which were perfectly tasty, with a very small scoop of potato salad, and two other salads I can't remember now. Believe me, I was still hungry. $24. Was I going to make ANOTHER order of wings?? WTF. Beyond disappointed. So some really really good (it was tasty), just no other food options and my friends were already there). C'mon now Mars, vet your food partners a little more.
author: Matt B.

description:
Local SOMA dive near AirBnB, Zynga, and other tech businesses.

Tends to fill up quickly, but there's more seating in their back patio, which is a nice way to take advantage of the SOMA micro-climate. 

Do expect dive service. Hardened expressions from bartenders, folks sitting at the bar aren't there for conversation, and simple foods like sliders and fries might take over 40 minutes to arrive.

However, drinks are reasonably priced and are actually pretty tasty. Just don't think of this as your standard affair hipster lounge.
author: Anthony N.

description: What a great hang out for a busy sunday afternoon in the city. Nice patio and free wifi. I brought the labtop and people watched. Service was fantastic. Drink was pretty good too and GREAT DJ Sunday afternoon. Will definitely come back :)
author: Amanda D.

description:
A friend and I wanted to try this place for their Happy Hour tacos. This place is pretty divey, but spacious. We went ahead and sat outside in the patio, which had an ample amount of tables to occupy; my friend and I wilingly sat at the table next to this really pretty waterfall. Although the patio was superb, the service and food was OK.

Service was fine...they did their jobs and took our orders, but that was it. They weren't that friendly, no smile, no hospitality. Though, they did their job. That was it. We also wanted to ask for salsa to go with our chips, but they just swooped right passed us a couple of times. It wasn't even that crowded to be honest...and I've seen both crowded venues and great customer service and attention. Finally got a waiters attention but by raising my voice a notch. I shouldn't have to do that, since it's rude. But what goes around comes around. 

The pork tacos were pretty tasty and good, but the chips had no salsa to go with it what so ever. Who gives chips without salsa??? Seriously? This is what lead to that tiny waiter fiasco. Secondly, Happy Hour tacos (on a taco Tuesday) for $2 each? That seems a bit pricey for me. I've had better tacos for $1 each in other places. Plus, free chips with salsa. Man, really? 

The place also got more cold and windy, they didn't turn on the heaters. What's the point? Anyway, it was an OK venue, but what I really liked about my time here was catching up with my friend and trying something new. Inside the bar seems pretty cool, so I wouldn't mind staying there next time and trying their Happy Hour on Wednesdays, which is $5 cheese pizza.
author: Michelle S.

description:
im new to soma and always looking for a good lunch spot. i was reading pretty rockin reviews for mars and that they had a patio and it was a gorgeous day, so i started walking over. i was excited because i love a great new experience! 
walked in, it was empty - monday afternoon before happy hour i suppose. there was one person at the bar and i saw a sign that said "order at the bar" so i waited. 
the bartender said "let me get with that guy then I'll come to you" ...... i used to be in the service industry & i would never say that to someone. getting their drink order, along with "that guy" would take no longer than saying you'll be back to me. at the very least, give out a menu? then he proceeded to quickly take the man's order, put it in the computer, and run around like there was so much to do.... but literally just moving things around........ um, hello? maybe he was trying to leave early? idk. 
anyways, i asked for a menu and a water, as well as his suggestions on what to order since I'd read great yelp reviews about the food. he gave me a few options & i picked a blackened chicken sandwich and asked to add a caesar salad. 
i never got my water, but saw they had some hot water and cups outside- i didnt want to bother the really busy bartender again, so i just drank that. food came within 15 min, the sandwich was good. fries were also tasty. wish i hasnt gotten the salad, super bland/watery so i didnt eat it. 
had i been at a real restaurant (this seems like more of a bar), i would have asked to talk to the manager about their employees aloofness, and sent back the salad. but  i didnt because they are what they are, nothing fancy! which i expected a chill little joint - which is what it is, just disappointed in the service, so i wont be back.
author: Taylor N.

description: These people are completely unethical and if you point it out to them, they will ridicule you and cast aspersions upon your person and your physical appearance, because that is the only recourse for the unethical person since they have no moral justification for what they do. Their brunch cocktails went from $3 each to $8 each. They don't bother to tell any of the many websites promoting their weekend brunch. I even asked when I walked in if they were still doing the weekend brunch with the cocktails thing. I can honestly say I've never been treated worse anywhere in my life... so much so that I had to write this review. Avoid this place like the plague.
author: Jasper F.

description: Great Dive Bar in SF that caters to all the nearby tech companies. On every third and fourth Friday Nights during Happy Hour they have a great DJ on the wheels of steel - Felix Hwang. Check it out for the libations, atmosphere and music
author: Matthew R.

description: This is my favorite place to spend my afternoons and my birthday each year.  The food is delicious (especially those amazing burgers!), the staff is great and the energy of the space is very inviting.  Excellent live music played by some of the top DJs and both indoor and outdoor seating make Mars Bar a home away from home for me.
author: Tina N.

description: We hosted a small party at Mars Bar last weekend and could not be happier.  From our first contact Mars Bar was extremely easy to work with - responsive, friendly and flexible.  We told them our general wishes for the party and they were flexible in accommodating our needs.  The service during the party was fantastic.  Food for the group was always fresh, drinks were full and tables were cleared.  They were fantastic at anticipating what needed to happen and taking initiative.  I am used to hosting parties and always having to split my attention between logistics and socializing.  Mars Bar made it easy for me to relax and actually talk to our guests.  The food was great, the bar service was great, the venue was flexible and comfortable.  They pride themselves in being a family business and this shows in how they work with their guests and clients.  We highly recommend hosting an event here!
author: Vanessa N.

description:
We recently hosted a private event at Mars Bar to celebrate our startup company's launch. Keith (the owner) and his staff were extremely helpful every step of the party planning process and went above and beyond for us! 

The Space
The space is larger than you'd expect - it really opens up in the back to a nice outside area with a tiki bar. We were able to comfortably host 250+ guests without it feeling cramped. As a bonus, they allowed us to decorate, put up signage and move tables around however we wanted!

The Food
No complaints here. The food served for our party pleased the crowd. We ordered lots of finger foods like sliders, skewers, quesadillas, etc. I've had lunch here a few times outside of a party environment as well and was very impressed with the salmon sandwich!

The Service
We couldn't have asked for better. The team helped us create a signature cocktail to be served throughout the night and wore our company swag. A few hours before the party, we realized we needed additional help to check in party guests. Keith pulled through by arranging extra staff for us, no problem. :)

Overall, I'd highly recommend this space for a fun, laidback vibe event! We'll certainly be back!
author: Anne F.

description: This is fun upbeat place for hh, lube wrestling in the back or fundraisers with your favorite DJs. It's a place for everyone and was in the area long before Zynga and Airbnb hit the scene.  It's a lot loud so if you want quite it's better on the heated patio but it ain't quiet. Also they have plant life in the back and that always makes me happy.  One star off because food is just ok and I'd love it if there was somewhere a 40 dB lower.
author: Andre G.

description:
There is NOTHING not to like about Mars Bar.  

Thank you for being so nice to a bunch of Hasher degenerates like my husband and I the past two years that we have gone there. Kind, professional and nice - your veggie burger made my toes curl. 

Hell yes I will be back! 

Stay cool! 

xo
author: Patricia Patti P W.

description: Love this place. They make a great drink and have a cool steak sandwich.  I always pop into this place when I am shopping for Diamonds at Padis Jewlery in the Mart....
author: D.D. D.

description:
The people I work with apparently live at this place (when they're not working) - and it's also our go-to place to say goodbye to folks (which is too often these days).

Nice large patio out back, but the heaters are either always off or blasting so hard my head is melting. 

Can't say the food is fantastic, but they bring it quickly and even with a large crowd it's satisfying bar snacks. Plenty of drinks/beers for my taste (Lagunitas, several kinds) - but nothing to write home about.

Gets crowded inside, but that's a good sign.
author: Joshua B.

description: Great little corner bar. We had  Guinness on tap and Really good hard cider. Recommend the nachos and onion rings which came with bbq sauce. Yummy.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: It's been a while but I almost forgot that this is one of those gems in the rough. Back when this neighborhood was a bit more gritty, I'd come for a gathering. Lots of nooks and spaces to hang with your drink. But the hidden off patio maybe the winner on a nice day/night.
author: Kim N.

description:
We had our company launch party here and it was AHMAZING! Keith and his team were very on top of things and did what it took to make sure we had a great time. The DJ, overall vibe, and great tasting food made our party that much better! Would definitely go back and have another party here or just go to hang out with the awesome team at Mars Bar.

Special shout out to Keith for helping us get the supplies back to our office!
author: Taylor D.

description: They have heaters on the patio and fresh squeezed IPA on tap, what more could a girl want? It gets pretty loud here but that's the only drawback I could see during happy hour on a weds night. I'll be back.
author: Tera K.

description: First time here for lunch it is a nice mellow place. The food was made correctly and the burger was yummy. Shira, was a really nice person and gave me  her best service. Keith was a nice polite person greeted me at the bar not many people do that. Would most defiantly come back here and bring couple of friends. Once they turn 21.
author: Aldo G.

description: Well, I went here for the first time because I was forced to redeem my old credit card miles for restaurant.com gift cards before they expired, and this was one of the places that accepts them. I got the portobello burger, which was pretty good. It came with a side, and my server, Noah, suggested a few kinds of fries or a Caesar salad. I chose the Caesar salad, only to find that when I got the bill, they charged me an extra $2 for that salad. I paid the bill, but when I politely suggested to Noah that if he is going to suggest certain sides, he should tell the customers beforehand if those sides are an upcharge. Instead of taking the suggestion gracefully, he got defensive and said that most people already know it's more and that it's "in the menu." He also said he could've charged me $2 for substituting Bleu cheese for Swiss, but for some unknown reason, he didn't mention anything about that until now. Then he gave me a sarcastic "well, enjoy your day" as he walked away. Decent food, bad attitude, unprofessional customer service. Overall: Bummer.
author: Nathan O.

description: Had the pulled pork which was delicious. French Fries were overly greasy so didn't care for them. 1st Moscow Mule was flat, but the other 2 were fresh.
author: Koby G.

description: I've come here a few times for lunch and for drinks after my nearby internship. The bartenders are fast and fun and the food is crazy good. Their taco tuesday is hard to beat- 2 substantial tacos and chips for less than the cost a starbucks latte. I've sat inside and out and had takeout- I've enjoyed every experience and look forward to coming back again soon.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Clearly this is a place where people from Zynga and Twitter hang out after work. There are a lot of young professionals that go here, and it threw me off. I came to celebrate a friend's birthday, with a bunch of people who grew up in SF. FYI, we don't tend to mingle with transplants, unless the transplants are cool. =p

I kind of liked this place, mostly for the patio in the back. There's a little holding pen for those who like to smoke, and can't do it elsewhere. I appreciate this, as I never like exiting a bar and walking through a cloud of cigarette smoke. 

The staff here are very friendly, and good with service even when its packed. When I went to the outdoor bar to order a drink for my friend, I watched her pour two fingers of Jamison into the drink before adding a splash of ginger ale and lime. Awesome. Gotta love it when they're not stingy! 

I'm kind of at a 3.5, but the people there are a little irking. I mean, when we're a group of people sitting at the table 10 feet from the doors, do you REALLY have to stand between us and the door? Cause...people walk in/out of that thing...you know?? And group that chanted "CHUG CHUG CHUG" to the guy who downed a bottle of beer? Yeah. No. If there's no funnel or liter worth of beer, "CHUG" is not the appropriate chant.

Also...the parents who bring a toddler here. YOU are a parent now. Sorry, dive bars are not appropriate for small children. Deal with it.
author: Lily W.

description: I have been meaning to check out this place for so long and I finally did yesterday, I got there little after 4p  so the place was empty with just few people hanging out, great HH prices, I got mine cold hefeweizen beer for $4 and went outside to the patio where you are surrounded by plants and it felt like I stepped into a bar in Mexico, just homey. I hanged out there for about 2 hours reading  my book and the place just kept getting busier and busier. I will be back for sure.  Great place to unwind after work.
author: Magda G.

description:
Came here for a company lunch today. A 3.5 place, but not a place I can see myself going to all the time, so I'll bump it to a three. To be fair, I hear good things about the bar, so don't let my review detract you from checking out its bar scene.

Service was pretty spectacular and the food was alright. I ordered a chicken sandwich with fries which was decent. Classic bar food--salads, burgers, the likes. They have daily specials which are pretty good and the waitresses were all really nice and accommodating of our party which was definitely pretty cool.

Chill place, saw a lot of fancy dressed people eating there. Good atmosphere, really nice to eat at outside!
author: Jasmine X.

description:
This used to be my go to burger place. We ordered 5 burgers....none of which was correct. They left at least one, if not two items off every burger (a bacon cheese burger is not that difficult an order, come on). Inexcusable for me was that my rare burger was well done. They cooked every single burger to the wrong temperature.

There are too many other good burger places in the neighborhood. Go to Brainwash instead.
author: Kristen M.

description: Went here for lunch on a weekend. Food is pretty good.  Had the burger,  medium rare and it was cooked just right. The service is good too,  friendly .  Overall,  no complaint.  Will be back if I am in the area.
author: Atmos H.

description:
More than your typical dive bar, Mars Bar & Restaurant combines tasty food and strong drinks.

The Buffalo chicken wings are some of the best in the Bay Area: hot and spicy without destroying your taste buds.  Juicy and hot, the burger is solid, but won't make the 7 x 7 "Best San Francisco Burgers" list. The Cesar salad is solid, but is soaked with a little too much dressing.

The best part of Mars Bar & Restaurant is the drinks: strong and not too expensive.  A good selection of liquors is complemented by at least 7 beers on tap.  Bartenders have a heavy hand, so drink responsibly.

The interior is loud, loud, loud, but the back room with pool table and the patio are a little more chill.  On the patio, space heaters keep you warm, while a fountain keeps you mellow.

The staff is pretty hard core, barely breaking cracking a smile, but the service is always good. 

A trip to Mars Bar & Restaurant will get you into orbit, while saving you the fare you would have paid on Virgin Galactic.
author: CJ G.

description:
Come here after a show at SOMA arts gallery. I've been wanting to try this place for a while. What a great little spot. Great outdoor patio's, ordered a burger and fries which were excellent, and a full bar to boot. I couldn't be happier. Local spot, mixed crowd, good vibes, cold beer, crisp fries, juicy burger, clean, pleasant- getting the picture. 
Next time I'm coming for lunch on a sunny day. Can't wait.
author: Matt A.

description: This is a great hole in the wall bar. Great friendly staff. Great to meet someone for a first date. Closes a little early on Sunday's though.
author: Victor L.

description:
SoMa is not full of bars, especially ones that just give good service, food and good drinks. You can definitely find fancy ones that charge an arm and a leg for a martini, but really, sometimes you just want to have a pint and relax. 

this is my go to place in for great well drinks and good talks with neighbors.
pretty good tunes, especially on weekends, and still one of the only places in SF that has an outdoor sitting space for smokers, so they don't feel like outcasts from society.
 
hope the owners hold strong, and not sell out to a random tech company!
author: I A.

description:
Very bad customer service.  Took forever to take our order.  After we got our order we had to walk around the bar and find someone to give us some cutlery.  Afterwards, had to flag about ten people down to order more drinks before happy hour was over (guess what? by the time we got someone - happy hour was over). 

Paid with cash, and waited for our change to tip appropriately, but the waitress automatically assumed we were leaving the entire amount for her (over 20% tip), and never brought back our change.  We were adamant about leaving a tip that reflected their service, and asked for our change.  

Don't understand how this place exists and is in service.  The extra star for the decent food.
author: Ghizal A.

description: Had lunch at Mar's a couple of times while I was on Jury Duty.  Burger the first time and French Dip the second and both were YUMMY!!!
author: Joanie D.

description: The bar is nice and has an excellent environment. My bad experience though had to be getting drinks at this place. The server, Andre, clearly ignored us for over 20 minutes, serving other customers before us. When I waved him down, he rudly yelled "i see you", but he clearly didn't because he served well over 7 other customers before me. I usually judge bars by how well they serve customers and Andre was definitely at the bottom of my bar experience.
author: Nathan N.

description: Can't beat their happy hour! They have good food and a heated patio. Overall great atmosphere after a long day of work.
author: Nelson G.

description: The Mars bar and restaurant was a pleasant experience for me. I just love their outdoor patio and indoor ambience. The food is delicious and affordable the drinks are awesome so much to choose from this is not your average bar and restaurant establishment. The first day I went there and had lunch in the outdoor patio plenty of sun great food great service what more could ask for. But it gets better I did ask for more private catering for a special event and none of the food was left over everything was amazing. I would definitely recommend this place to anybody whether it's lunch dinner or just drinks or private catering. The staff is amazing felt right at home I can't wait to go back. A real piece of San Francisco in historical Soma area.
author: yelp m.

description: Mars is pretty great.  A decent amount of outdoor space and some pretty good taps.  And a fantastic portobello mushroom sandwich with Swiss... yum.  French dip looked good too.
author: Aaron M.

description: Mars Bar is my home away from home. Come here for the friendliest staff, great music and only positive vibes.
author: Kaili L.

description:
We stopped in here for a pre-dinner drink after Renegade Craft Fair.

The bar is clean, patrons and bartender were friendly, drinks were reasonably priced, and my dirty martini was well made.

What more could you ask for from a neighborhood bar?
author: Amanda G.

description: I love this place, and come here all the time. The food is always fresh and delicious ( tacos, salmon salad and pizzas are my favorite). Love the outdoor seating and full bar. All around great place.
author: Rhonda G.

description:
The local dive and a pretty good bar menu.

Not expensive, no frills, get it and get down.

Nice patio area if the weather if good.

Great service. TV's for the game.

Pulled pork and Fish n Chips are good in my book.
author: Baron C.

description:
Not too shabby for a SF bar. Good size place so it doesn't feel crowded when it is super dupe crowded.  Always filled with GIANTS fans. So definitely a good place to watch the game.  Friendly security and 1 pool table. 

Have to teach the bartender how to pour a Guinness though.  Major fail.  Guess fruity drinks are just the only thing they make good.
author: Hazel K.

description:
Great atmosphere, very good food, great happy hour and prices, friendly staff...

We go often and it is a great neighborhood place to hang out!  Great prices!

Highly recommended!
author: Lyndsey C.

description: A cute divey bar with a large patio and all the beer.
author: Tasha D.

description:
I've been to Mars Bar in two contexts: post-work socializing, and jury duty lunch hour. For the former, I'd give it a definite four and possibly five stars; for the latter, more like 3ish. It's been awhile since I took math, but I think four overall sounds reasonable?

This is great place for happy hour. They can easily accommodate large groups either outside on the patio or indoors, and have a decent lineup of beers as well as house cocktails. I vaguely remember a $2 Tecate special at some point, if you're able to choke down that stuff. They also have plenty of food to nibble on, though I cannot for the life of me remember what I've eaten. Maybe this means they pour the cocktails strong? 

Regarding lunch - I've been here twice now during my prolonged stint in jury duty. I ordered the pasta special one day (ravioli marinara), and found it quite yummy; a sandwich the other time was so-so. The quality of service is a bit capricious, and varies even during the same visit with the same server, for no apparent reason. On one visit I felt alternately like the waitress was super-friendly and attentive, or cranky and hard to track down. Weird, but whatever... I can deal. Said visits were roughly around the December "holidays" when many people are on vacation, so there's a fair chance that my experience was atypical (e.g. fewer waitstaff available/scheduled, fewer patrons than usual, etc). 

In short, Mars Bar is a decent bet. Come for drinks, come for food. If you come during jury duty be aware that you may longingly stare at the wall of liquor, wishing you could have a beer to take the edge off the more tedious witnesses. Be strong! The wheels of justice are not meant to be lubricated by alcohol.
author: Janna M.

description: Went to lunch with my workers and ordered the steak salad. Service was courteous and prompt. The food came out without much delay and tasted as expected. The atmosphere is casual, making this a good place for lunch. Everything was good but not extra ordinary. My friend's burger and fries looked rather tasty though and I found myself wishing that I had tried that instead, maybe next time.
author: David S.

description: Love this place! Its the perfect blend of casual and friendly without any of the douchitude that so many SF bars have.
author: Amy P.

description: So, we came here after not coming here for for a few years. It's close to the ball park so we figured it would be a cool spot. Our first bar tender was cool- great red curly hair. Don't know where she went when some Mexican guy named Sergio came around... He was cool! He doesn't look Mexican, looks kinda Filipino and he's from Fresno. Who's from Fresno!? Anyway- it was an overall great bar experience thanks to Sergio and the occasional German guy (Michael) convos. We'll definitely be back! By the way, the spicy margarita- not that great, but if you pretend, Sergio will be extra nice! Ruffio!!!
author: Laida D.

description:
(See pics)

Review #1047.

Local bar with a full menu of different burgers, salad and pizzas. There is a nice outside sun shining seating area as well as a pool table inside.

The French dip I had was just okay but this most likely is a more fun place to hang out for a drink than lunch.
author: T L.

description:
Great staff, terrific drinks and an awesome burger!  Cody makes a great Manhattan, and introduced me to his Smokey Manhattan (with a 1/2 oz of Laphroaig). Definitely going to do that one again. My party all ordered burgers and everyone was thrilled with the flavor and quality. After the kitchen closed I had an opportunity to met Alfredo, the cook. I let him know that the burger was definitely one of my top 10 burgers in the city. 

If you are in the neighborhood, swing by and you'll see what I'm talking about. And I think all of the bad reviews were written by angry tech-workers who want everything done at warp speeds...speaking of that, the service was fantastic and friendly, even though they were quite busy upon our arrival.
author: Jimbowicz J.

description: I love this dj bar.  The back patio is sweet.
author: Michelle R.

description:
Meh.  Nothing great to say, nothing bad to say. 

Typical dive bar without much personality.  There's a patio, there's some food, some music. Never too crowded.
author: Skye W.

description:
Ok I have been a long time marsbar friend. But tonight I helped eject a person who was nasty. Instead of respect I get accused of hustling dranks.my name is Gabriel and I have been a regular there off and on and until I get an apologies you guys do not get another dime. Over the last few years I have been a faithful customer. I feel like I was kicked in  The nads. Make it right

K
author: Gabriel O.

description: This place is super cute.  It's super close to my work, so after a big meeting we all went to Mars.  It was a great venue for a group and I will come back to visit.
author: Rob M.

description:
So this is the local bar by my job, and it's a pretty good watering hole to have close by :)

Pool table, outside patio, good drinks, nice bartenders. 

Stop  in and grab a drink :)
author: Aarash Z.

description: I used to come to Mars Bar all the time, but my 20s are long gone.  I stopped here once with a friend spontaneously.  We just had a beer, she needed to get on BART at a decent time to head home.  We really had fun catching up and I was reminiscing the days coming here dancing and having big fun with friends.  The DJ was awesome, he played songs per our request.  When I requested the Beastie Boys he played a medley of the BB's.  Awesome.  I must come back for another visit. :)
author: Liz D.

description: Man o man... what an experience today. came here for lunch and the service and food was just sad. I use to come here a lot especially after work to get drinks and appetizers and even dinner sometimes, but TODAY!!!!!!!!!!! we weren't even offered a seat, had to seat our selves, did not give us menus had to get it my self, ginger ale was flat as hell, so we asked for a sprite and that took forever, then the food came....... OMG! I had a turkey burger and my friend had a regular burger and I cant begin to tell you how terrible it was, the turkey burger tasted as if it was cooked frozen and season-less mmm mmm mmm even the fries were yuk too. I am so disappointed, i probably will not be back. After service and food like this im gonna have to say GOOD BYE to the MARS BAR......
author: Yolanda M.

description: Absolutely the worst service I've ever encountered.  Annalee, what a joke! I had to almost do jumping jacks to get water.  Napkins forget about it! Then my cheeseburger had no cheese. And to top it all off I was charged for someone else's meal.  If you want bad service, overpriced tasteless food then hit mars bar.  Otherwise head for a new orbit and have some good food.
author: Kymberli J.

description:
When I first sat down at the bar, I got worried. The place was mostly busy for lunch, and it looked like the staff was running around. It didn't feel organized.

But I was served quickly and taken care of, so don't let it fool you.

The food was pretty good, though I felt like I was missing out when getting the veggie burger.

I need to come back and try out more of the menu.
author: Jeff M.

description: Visited for a casual business lunch and heard the food was good. Outside patio seating on a sunny day sealed the deal. I had the flank steak sandwich ordered and beautifully prepared "charred-rare". Juicy red with that taste of broiled char. New prep request for the Chef who excelled! Crispy fries and a creamy Guinness and I'm a happy guy. My colleague had the charred-seared salmon sandwich...with those crispy fries and a decent sauvignon blanc. Shout-out to Anton and his friendly, personalized service!
author: Chadwick S.

description: Good cocktails, cheap drinks, chill atmosphere, good bar snacks and bites, pool table, 2 outdoor areas, its pretty much the perfect place when the sun is shining in SF
author: Cali J.

description: Came here on a saturday afternoon to kill some time and i totally dig this place! low key vibe, couple tv's with college football and super friendly staff. I hear the food is good...all i got was chips and salsa but really enjoyed the guac that came with it. I had 3 drinks (1 beer and 2 mixed drinks and the chips/salsa) and came out to only $30! so cheap. atleast i think so...coming from LA :)
author: Nikki J W.

description: Anyone that does not enjoy this place to the fullest has a personal problem. I work very nearby and after sampling the other food/drink options in the area, of course decided Mars was the spot. I have been coming here for years now and have never had a bad experience. If my food/drink is not what I expected (not often), it's taken and corrected without a fuss. They will bend over backwards to keep their customers happy, but if your complaint is that you had to wait 10 minutes while sitting in a gorgeous outdoor patio during a busy happy hour....maybe you should go out more and get some real issues. I'd give 10 stars if I could!
author: Nicole K.

description:
DA SPOT

This is a perfect happy Hour bar, good location, parking is easy.  I have been coming here for years and there is never a disappointment.  The place is always jumping.  Good mix crowd.  I enjoy hanging out on the open patio.  Bartenders are cool, drinks are good.  Happy hour food is good.  Perfect spot to get started before the real party begins.  Nroute to the next spot.  i will definately  be back..
author: Nic C.

description: Great little spot for drinks, big outside area available on nice days. but what I really love is that I lost an earring on a particularly busy night a while back. After trying to find it I let the bartender know and asked her to keep an eye out for it. at most places that would be the last you hear from the bartender but this person ends up calling me the next day that she found it after they closed. So grateful!
author: laura f.

description:
In love with Summer Sundays on the patio after yesterday. 

it's as if all the really really ridiculously extroverted people decided to converge on one spot on the one day when everyone else is still nursing a hangover from the night before.

New Sunday tradition. no question.
author: Mike V.

description: The food and service are outstanding. I've had lunch many times...never disappointed. Check out the steak salad or the fish & chips. The owner is very hands on....he even finished and installed the new bar and tabletops.
author: Brian C.

description:
Beats and burgers.

Beats: Sitting in the patio felt like a Winter Music Conference afternoon. Not as hot as Miami Beach but the house music was just as warm. 

Burgers: Grilled chicken had plenty of flavor. Apple slices were a nice touch. Same with the side of house pizza sauce. Went well with the burger.

Price ($11) was high. Too high. Have had better and cheaper burgers elsewhere.

But you do get a patio and a side of house music.
author: Jason B.

description: This place is my version of CHEERS....always greeted by name and they all know how to make lemondrops the way I like them.....friendly atmosphere, good food and ALWAYS good lemondrops!
author: Mimi M.

description:
Boom this place rocks ! 
One of the more fun places to be in sf 
Specially on Sunday 
Atmosphere is real cool and everyone is really nice
author: Michal S.

description: The beer is fine. Standard taps. But the pricing?! Cripes, who charges $80 for 2 burgers and a pitcher? SOMA - stop draining my money! My wallet cries at night.
author: Dora C.

description: Let me start by saying that the chicken wing situation in this city is seriously lacking. That being said, we ended up at Mars after the previous venue "ran out of wings" the previous day. I have to say I was pretty impressed. We went on a Monday so we enjoyed the half price wing special, $4.95 for 6 healthy wings--extra saucy (the way I like them). My only complaint, I asked for extra hot wings and the bartender warned me that there are mexicans in the back and they can make them REALLY hot--they weren't that hot. Otherwise I would go back. Definitely came through for us in a big way when we were in a tight spot.
author: Ben K.

description: I LOVE this place.... I have been coming here for a few years now. The staff is friendly and take care of you. The patio in the summer is wonderful. You can relax with friends or come alone and you will be just fine. They have Djs spinning great music. I tip my hat to the manager and staff.You all rock! Jj
author: Jay B.

description: I went here with a small group and left dissatisfied. I was hungry and got excited about the $5 cheese pizza happy hour special. Great deal right? Well there is a reason. The pizza is downright terrible, seriously some of the worst I've ever had. The marinara was utterly tasteless. One of the mixed drinks was also a miss. Cute neighborhood bar & the friendly bartender unfortunately won't tempt me back.
author: Meredith V.

description: The coolest place is town to grab a casual drink. The staff, the vibe, the drinks, and overall enviroment is great.
author: Amanda M.

description:
I'm so disappointed right now with my food...I work right down the street from the Mars and go there quite a bit. My favorite use to be Fridays Fish and chips...today I called in the order and get there to pick it up. YIKES! WTF? Who uses Two skinny pieces of .tilapia for fish & chips?  Tilapia for fish and chips 
So disappointed. ..#epicfail no more fish and chips for me...I may try taco Tuesdays again, I hope they're not on this budget. #codforfishnchips
author: Paulette J.

description:
Came here for an early lunch before heading out of the city, and trying to beat the SF Giant's Parade that was going on just a mile or so down the road.  I saw this place on Scoutmob and the 4 star rating on Yelp made it a MUST try, didn't even have to read the reviews to see what was recommended.

Emily was the best Server I've had in a long long time, plus it helps that she's such a cutie too ;-)  I couldn't decide between the Chicken Wrap and the French Dip but she helped with that decision and I ended up getting the French Dip with Swiss Cheese.  It was delicious and one of the Best French Dips I've had in a while, even though some of the meat was on the dry side.  It was stacked with meat which many restaurants now a days are going cheapo on, so it was very nice to see them do this sandwich right.  I soaked my French Dip in their flavorful Au Jus and even ordered a second bowl of it.

I'll definitely be going back here for lunch again, even if it's to see that cutie Emily ;-)  I didn't try any of their beer, wine, or other drinks so I can't comment on anything except the exceptional service and good food.
author: Arthur Z.

description: After my poor review, the manager reached out to me with his apologies and asked for any more feedback I could give. I appreciate this a lot, and shows they want to improve. I will give it another try.
author: Lydia L.

description: Great local bar, my favorite to grab slow key drink and some grub on nights I don't feel like cooking. Only cut a star because the pool table needs maintenance, otherwise everything is great!!
author: Joina L.

description: What an awesome little dive! Wandering around the city with my bff, and we found this little dive after a full day at the Renegade. We were warmly greeted by two amazing bartenders - Cody was great and whipped me up a Sazerac. I didnt catch the name of the other bartender, but he was nice as well. Cody was quite entertaining and very friendly. This bar has a great vibe, friendly staff - and we met a new friend, who offered great conversation and kindly paid for our drinks. Love this place, and would definitely come back when I'm in the area again
author: Wenda T.

description: This place is the shit! Cody is a great bartender and he can do it all. I went to Mars on a Saturday night after the cooks went home, the bar back called in sick, and the man was solo. He held his own and left nobody hanging. He served great cocktails, cooked up some great bar food, and played amazing music. Do yourself a favor and check out the Mars Bar when Cody is up in the house. Personality for days and he'll make you feel like you're right at home. They also have a fantastic patio to chill out on after a long day.
author: Dustin O.

description: We came on a weeknight to grab a few drinks.  The sweet tea cocktail was perfect - not too sweet and was not too strong or weak.  It was a pretty chill evening and the bartender was friendly.  Nice place to hang and grab some drinks.
author: Kay C.

description:
I live across the street from Mars Bar, so I wish I liked it more than I do.  The food is good although a little pricey for what it basically a bar with a few tables, but the service is terrible.  You almost have to trip a waitress to get her attention.  I have gotten up and left more than once.  I wouldn't got back except that it is so damn convenient.

Drinks are expensive for a dive bar.  $6 for a Stella - $10 for a Manhatten.
author: David B.

description: terrible service, for whatever reason my table was invisible to the waitress. she dropped off the food then never came back to us but checked up on the tables to my left and right. other than the food being decent, i'll give this place a 1 star. i wouldn't recommended it to anyone.
author: Marty I.

description:
Came here after the Bizarre Bazaar last month. Since we found parking right in from it was very convenient to stop in for a drink after shopping. 

The bartender made a nice Manhattan and was very friendly. The early evening patrons were all very friendly and we had a nice time chatting while enjoying our drinks.
author: Chuck K.

description:
A nice little dive bar. The fact that it's across the street from the office is an added bonus.

Nice selection of beers and BOMB ASS NACHOS. Outdoor area is perfect for warm and especially sunny days. Random DJ is pretty awesome too.

Service can be a bit slow, so you may want to order pitchers and bring cash if you're impatient.
author: Annie L.

description:
On this sunny Thursday afternoon, I watched the baseball team of my childhood (Go Twins!) take on the baseball team of my middle-adulthood (Vamos Gigantes!).  Thanks to a trial run of Bert's Bees SPF 15, every single member of our outing got a rather severe sunburn.  It was a great game, with good folks, in good seats, on a beautiful day.

Afterwards, we went to Mars Bar, primarily because my friend intended to celebrate Sonic's 20th birthday with others who were similarly invested in Sonic's once-and-future success.  In our small group of 20 or so hard core geeks, I managed to bump into no fewer than 2 former Wyomingites, so we got to commiserate about the very best decision we ever made in our entire lives (maybe I'm projecting....).

The service was decent, the prices were awesome, the bar didn't care that we imported enough food to provision an expeditionary force (including cupcakes with Sonic's face on them).  I continued a bar tradition (of mine) by wholloping somebody at the pool table.

It IS hard to catch a cab outside this place.  And the walk from AT&T isn't what one would call picturesque (other than South Park, which is really charming).  The bottom line is, it's a bar.  It's a totally decent bar, and I would go back.  But that's about the long and short of it.
author: Ben P.

description:
I've been here a few times, but mostly as a starter for a long night of drinking. I had never had their food or been there for happy hour. I LOVE their back patio - it's great for nice nights in the city. 

This time, I was there for lunch with a group of colleagues (we were in a CDC STD Disease Investigator training) and we stayed for their subsequent happy hour. We had a lot of fun! I had a burger - pretty damned good, I must say. We stuck around for happy hour and played a couple of very dirty, "getting to know you"-type drinking games together. The staff were all really cool about a giant group of people taking up a lot of space for a few hours. We got pretty good service and had a good time. Their happy hour specials weren't great, but they weren't unreasonable, either. Their normal drink prices are a little on the high side, though, especially for a dive bar. Overall, I like the place, and I'm sure I'll be back again.
author: Jennifer V.

description:
First timer.

Pros
- Easy (as fas as SF) street parking
- Nice pub ambience
- Very attentive staff
- Nachos were tasty and crunchy

Cons
- I got nothing :-)

Will come back for sure.
author: Guio L.

description:
I've always had a good time at Mars Bar.

Their outdoor patio sporting huge spanning heat lamps, their tasty kitchen food, their outdoor bar area, their in-house hand drum set, and their laid back staff - have always been big pluses.

But it can be so easy to forget about Mars Bar. Because. I never happen to be "in the area" on the weekend. Because. I'm never up on their event schedule. Because. I rarely have friends who are dancing it up here.

Until recently that is...

These past two weekends, when I've been eagerly hunting down a good dance weekend spot - I've ended up at Mars Bar and have been reminded of why Mars Bar rocks as a destination bar spot.

The crowd here - today and last week were great. Friendly, interesting, and just there to have a good time and dance. The music was on point as well. Local DJs, playing to a slightly burner crowd - all vibing off each other.

If you haven't been to Mars Bar - yet - get on it. 

Start following their weekly schedule. And be sure to take advantage of their no cover Summer Sundays - where they open up their back patio from 1pm till sundown.

And if you're looking for a bumpin party this coming Saturday - Mars Bar will be bringing it with their Crush O Matic party - featuring clothing designers like 22 Tycoon and super talented DJs  - like J Boogie.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: Fun bar to go to after work to grab a drink. I enjoy the outdoor patio and while I was in my masters program it was a convenient place to go meet friends.
author: Tory C.

description: Came here for New Years Eve for a space themed (private) party, and the venue was amazing! Great service, awesome patio, and terrific sound. So much fun!
author: Eliza D.

description: Tuesday is $2 carnitas tacos day. Didn't try anything else on the menu. Generous portion of tender pork with diced onion. This is definitely a spot to keep in mind for Tuesdays.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Stopped in here on our way to Renegade Craft Fair as myself and friends were starving. The place was full so we grabbed three stools at the bar, pretty much dead center in the middle of it.

We ordered our drinks and then asked for a kitchen menu. After we had figured out what we wanted (and closed our menus) it took about twenty minutes before the bartender even took our order. People kept asking to borrow our menus and somehow were able to order before us.

The drinks were pretty good. I had a few margaritas, they were 6$ (that may be a special as it was a Saturday) for a full beer glass full of margarita. I wouldn't say it was special but it was definitely a good standard and I enjoyed drinking them. 

They clearly weren't equipped to handle the traffic from the craft fair, as we waited over an hour and a half for our food. At that point, the three of us each had had at least two drinks, so we were drunk on an empty stomach which only made it worse. Our bartender took our order and from what we could gather, never put a ticket in to the kitchen.(She never admitted it, though; just said that the kitchen was "slammed." When our order came out, it was all wrong - we got a salad instead of a sandwich and my quesadilla was lacking the meat I ordered in it, which all leads me to believe she forgot to put it in and then was too embarrassed to ask us to repeat it after realizing.) Another one of the bartenders responded to our complaint and checked on the order and it was still another 1/2 hour before we got our food. (She was nice enough to equip us with some bar snacks. Appreciated.) When the manager found out, he comped us our food and apologized, which we all also appreciated. 

The food was slightly above average bar food - I had a quesadilla and the side of pico that came with it was salty and had a nice amount of heat to it. We had wings that were okay, and the nachos with carnitas were also just okay. My friend's salad was topped with steak (she had ordered the steak sandwich) that was really tasty and cooked to a nice medium rare. Overall, nothing special, but definitely not greasy bar food like you would expect - nice.

I liked the music and despite all their errors I was still cheering this place on. Bartenders and management were friendly - and also to his tribute, we saw the manager jump in to the kitchen to try to help the chef out once he figured what was going on. I appreciate that he was willing to get his hands dirty to help the situation and make his customers happy.

I'd be back if there isn't anything going on at the convention center and they aren't swamped. Seems like it would normally be a nice chill place for a Saturday afternoon. Also liked that they had the doors open so you got some sunshine.

I think this place would normally be 3 stars - just ok - but due to the service problems I really can't give them that rating.
author: Rachel B.

description:
Pros:
- I liked their fries with applewood smoked bacon and cheese on top.
- I enjoy their outdoor seating area with the giant umbrellas on lovely sunny days

Cons:
- food choices are pretty mediocre and nothing out of the ordinary.
author: Wendy T.

description: I'm in a billiards/pool league that plays in various bars in the city and this happened to be the last game of the season. It was a Monday night so it wasn't terribly busy. The bartender was attentive, but sometimes the service can be slow. I loved the music they played here. A mix of indie rock, grunge, and 80s. Not bad at all. They even have a kitchen too so you can order food while you're here. I didn't order anything as I ate before I came here. One of the few bar/restaurant combos I've been to in the city. The back patio is nice especially you can smoke your cancer sticks back here ;). The pool table is nice for one that's in a bar. Then again this isn't a typical bar for me. It's actually clean and devoid of that typical "bar small". Parking was definitely plentiful around the area.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
I held a casual pre-F8 Happy Hour for my company at Mars Bar and couldn't have been more pleased with the results. We had such a great time! Jenny the bar's owner was extremely helpful in planning and was always quick with correspondence. She came to the table with some great ideas and was super helpful in accommodating our fluctuating guest list.

When I got there, I was greeted by Saba who simply put, rocks. She was a pleasure to work with as were the bartenders Amber, Paul and Justin.

I would highly recommend choosing Mars Bar as a venue for your event, the staff is kind and fun, great drinks and food are terrific. The  spacious atmosphere can accommodate both small and larger parties. Bonus points for location if you are an SF startup. 

On behalf of BranchOut, I am very happy to give Mars Bar a solid 5 stars, we will most certainly be back!
author: Alison D.

description:
I went here with two friends after a event at the Concourse. The outside looks like the sort of place where you'd want to order a beer because the drinking glasses might be sticky.......but lo' and behold it is not! Pretty patio, delightful mixed drinks, friendly and sweet wait-guy. The bathroom is nice-looking and it doesn't stink either. We were there at the hour between the dog and the wolf and the kitchen was closed but I have no doubt what so ever that the food is great. Did I say the drinks were great?
Oh, and one more thing- I appreciate worldly young people. I am not young (54) and it is amusing/irritating/ sort of enlightening to recognize how some young people think they wrote the book on having a good time.......fortunately they were not at Mars Bar last month!
I will go back.
author: Gabby B.

description:
LET IT BE KNOWN: 
$5 Happy Hour pizza means cheese pizza, the others are regular price

DOCK 1 STAR for the server not explaining this to us when reeling off the HH specials, and the menu vaguely stating $5 pizza.  (there wasn't even a cheese pizza on the menu.. what the hell?) 

DOCK 1 STAR for ridiculously slow service on a Wednesday night.  It wasn't the server's fault, it was the fact that there seemed to really ONLY be one server in the whole place which had 5-6 tables seated inside - I didn't see if anyone was seated outside.

THREE STARS LEFT for the food.  The pizzas were good, especially the New Margarita (that's how they spell it) and the Garden pizza.  They have lots of beer to choose from and the nachos are great.  If they can get some more servers up in this B* I'd give it 4 stars easily.  If they cleaned up their half-assed menu, I'd give it 5.
author: Cora L.

description: Great local joint - good food and drinks. Love the outside patio and that it is dog-friendly.
author: Lis W.

description:
This is a pretty cool spot and like many people say, it's much bigger inside than it looks outside.  They have a nice patio area, but I wasn't able to hang out there, since a local company rented out the area.

Drinks aren't too overpriced and the food was decent.  It's a cool spot to hang out with a group, but it probably would have been better if the outside area was open.

Speaking of the local company, they have some douchey dudes working there.  Here was my conversation with one of them. 
DB: Are you with that girl?
Me: No, but she has a boyfriend and she's not the type to cheat on her bf.
DB: Cool (Turns to my friend)
DB: Hi, how are you doing, can I buy you a drink
Friend: I already have a drink, but thank you.
DB: Well, I'll buy you one anyway, let's take a picture.
