(15+ more minutes of continuing annoyance by DB)

I didn't really notice at the time, since my friend can usually handle herself and I don't like intruding on other people's game.  Also, I think it's funny to watch, but afterward she went on about how uncomfortable she was.  Maybe that's how the bar scene is nowadays. If it is, can someone confirm, so I can add it to my playbook. Anyway, it was probably an isolated incident and I'd probably go here again.
author: Joe N.

description: The people working here are super friendly! They aren't antisocial like a lot of bartenders. I left my backpack here and they kept track of it for me until the next day and even offered me a free drink when I went to pick it up!
author: Ben J.

description:
I used to come here a lot, when I worked nearby.  Right after work, it's not too bad.  They have some happy hour drink specials and different food specials each day.  The menu is nothing special but the pizzas are decent and are good to share as appetizers/small plates.  The outdoor patio is quite nice when the weather is clear, and the heaters make it comfortable even into the evening.

However... at night, this place gets douchey as hell. Especially on weekends.  It fills up with people who are trying so hard to impress each other and talk over each other... awful.  Plus they consistently book awful DJs and pump the music out so loudly that you can't even really hold a conversation with your friends.
author: Heidi M.

description:
might have just been a slow night

last friday night- i mean literally with no reference to the song. after a holiday party a group of us found our way here at MARS BAR. 

the place is right at the corner, well lit, hard to miss. a very spacious bar with plenty of  seating inside and outside! on the cold night we were there the outside was still warm with the giant space heater.

the drinks were just right, not light or heavy handed. 

it was chill. if most nights are like the time we went i'd recommend this place as a "wanna get away" type of place. then again, might have just been a slow night.

until next time

cheers!
author: Jerico P.

description:
I liked Mars Bar until this evening.

I arrived as part of a group of three around 5 for an early dinner before a show.  The place was slightly busy, but not packed.  We sat down and the waitress came over and asked us if we wanted drinks.  We ordered drinks and she returned with them in a few minutes.  However, when she delivered the drinks, she told us that she would come back in a few minutes to take our order.  STRIKE ONE- she didn't ask us if we were ready to order.  After a few minutes passed, I looked for the waitress and noticed that she was delivering food to other tables, taking orders, talking to other customers, and spoke on the phone for a few minutes.  STRIKE TWO - She didn't acknowledge the extra long wait.  A simply "sorry about the wait" would have gone a long way.  We received our food in a fairly decent time, and when the food arrived it was pretty tasty.  As we ate, she didn't check on the table to see if we needed anything until we were almost finished with our meal.  When she did arrive, she asked the only male at the table if he wanted a refill even though all of us were in need of a refill.  STRIKE THREE - I know that some waitress try and appeal to males to get bigger tips, and this waitress is one of them.  With her bottle hair color, she is there to cater to the males, but do not ignore the women at the table.  After we finished our meal, we had to go out of our way to flag her down for the bill and it took even longer for her to return and charge the card for our meal.  STRIKE FOUR - it shouldn't take that much work for us to get the bill and pay.  

I gave 1 star for the food.  The service was some of the worst I ever received. This is the first time that I refused to leave my customary 20% tip.  Maybe the waitress will learn that women are customers too.  

I will not be coming back and next time I will go to a bar where a female customer can get a refill.
author: Gabrielle W.

description:
This place pleasantly surprises me every time I come by.  Usually, I'm drawn in by the back patio, which is great for weekday happy hour.  But outside drinking aside, the food that I've experienced was better than most bars with comparable feel.  Now, I'm not saying you'll write home about the food, but really - who does that anyway?  

Is this place considered divey? I don't think so, but maybe...? I would suggest that it's on the distant fringe of divey, but then again my divey expectations are based on Philly standards.  

It's definitely worth checking out Mars Bar out if you're in the neighborhood and looking for somewhere to eat/drink outside and not spend a ton of money.
author: Stephanie F.

description:
I work on the next block and have always thought of Mars bar as just a bar, but recently a coworker asked me to go eat there and I was honestly a bit surprised at how good their food is (well, not really good, but I consider it good for a bar).

I've only tried their salads here. My fav is their ceasar salad (light on dressing) with beef or grilled chicken. You can also get it with Ahi Tuna and a couple of other kinds of meat. My other favorite is their Chicken Fiesta Salad. It's a big crazy in there with all the ingredients, but they all go really well together. 

Oh and also - don't order the salads togo with dressing on the side. Their dressings are a bit thick and when you mix it in yourself, it's not even and just doesnt taste the same. Have them toss the dressing in there and don't wait too long until you eat it!
author: Rosie W.

description:
I really like this bar - it has been a recent spot for some old coworkers and I to meet for Happy Hour.

They have a great outdoor patio (with heaters) and nice seating inside. Their beer selection is big and discounted before 7pm. Also, their food is great! I have tried the burger, nachos and pizza - all were very tasty.

I also LOVE that this is close to the freeway. Makes the out of towners more likely to show up to Happy Hour!
author: Jessica L.

description:
I think I have found my new favorite dive bar for Sunday fun days. The bartender Amber is amazingly quick and bad ass with lots of sexy ink. I never venture this far off the path but this place was so much fun. 

The music was pumping the the crowd was mixed it felt like an after party for burning man/ night at the roxbury there so much going on I loved the people watching and the people all seemed attractive. I felt like I was at a house party. 

 I don't know if it is like this every Sunday or I got lucky but I will I be coming back for sure. And the bloody Mary which I don't tend to drink past 2pm was not your everyday BS bloody Mary it spicy I have to give it a solid 9 well since amber made it I will give it a 10. The drinks are strong and food was quick I think I am in love...

Not to mention they have an outdoor patio what more can you really want...
author: Christian A.

description:
If you ever wanted to rent out a club for a party but didn't have the funds to do so, then Mars Bar is the place for you. Because of its location, you will rarely find this place remotely filled and is perfect if you want to call all of your friends to pack the place up. 

The bartenders are quite friendly and heavy handed when pouring cocktails, which let's be honest, is a rarity for the city. Drinks are moderately priced too. (Which is great since the cab ride costs more to drive out there than other bars we usually frequent). 

We had a birthday party for a friend there recently and they pushed out the pool table to make a dance floor. All in all, I would come back--because who doesn't love to see a disco ball every so now and again?
author: Nam N.

description:
Chill environment. No overcrowding. Cheap drinks. Good service.

I've come here for two different birthday bashes and each time was a blast! They both chose this place because the overpriced and overcrowded scene was getting to be too much. This is an excellent spot to celebrate with the company of chill friends.

The bartenders are very talkative and they make mildly-strong drinks for a cheap price. Mars Bar is broken up into three smaller areas. All different, all great spots to hang. The first is a full bar with stools and booths. The second is a spaced out dance floor with a spinning DJ. The third is an outside area with tables for people to get some fresh air. Both times I didn't pay cover because I was either on a guest list or it was a weekday. Which brings me to my next point...

Come here for Taco Tuesdays! These nights are awesome.

$2 tacos, $2 beers and very cheap drinks! I spent $20 for 6 tacos and 4 Tecates. Then $21 dollars for 3 shots of Jack Daniels (7.00 each). All of this for under $50. And this isn't including the other shots, drinks and beers I got from other people that night. This is a great place for friends to buy rounds for each other.

Mars Bar has become one of my favorite spots.
author: Andrew C.

description:
This is my work's bar.  We work literally across the street.

They have moderately price drinks, better if you flirt a little.  Also a pool table, without it taking up bar standing room, a sweet patio, and a DJ in the evenings.

The best thing about this place is Sabba, one of their waitresses.  She is beautiful and nice and my favorite part of that bar!

They also have outstanding garlic fries with a spicy aioli sauce that fucking great.
author: Meara G.

description: Busy visit and lock-key service but not without hospitality. Love patio and menu but long wait for food. Best is Keith that comped two free drinks. Better direction for ordering and seating could be good but this is a bar really, without table service. Be prepared and patient or lucky on a more subdued time. Curses on the service witching hour! Thanks Keith!
author: Elizabeth J.

description:
This is our go-to happy hour and lunch al fresco when it's nice out spot.  It's a block away from work and always reliable.

The drinks are strong and the bartenders are great.  The waitstaff is excellent, but be prepared to wait to order and for food on a hot day and during happy hour.

The menu has so much salty goodness that it isn't even funny.  What goes better with alcohol than fries, nachos, cheese sticks, pizza and wings?  Exactly.

I do quite like this place.
author: Melanie K.

description: I really liked Mars Bar- it has an outdoor patio which is so nice! Cozy, but the service is quick and the chef is a doll. Will be back again!
author: Colleen F.

description:
I'm in the minority in that I've only been here for lunch.  Several of my coworkers love this place, but I'm not sold on it.

The food is OK - apart from the burgers and the tuna ahi salad, everything else looks pretty mediocre.   Fish and chips on Fridays are OK, but again, not amazing.

The staff are friendly, and come by often to refill your soft drinks, which is a nice touch.

We had the $2 tacos (only on Tuesdays) and they were decent but definitely towards the bottom of the scale compared to others I've had in SF.

Can't comment on it as a bar, but for lunch, Hotel Utah is much closer to my office and the food is better.
author: dan s.

description: Went for happy hour last week and sat outside.  Ordered beers & onion rings.  Service was good and the onion rings were very good but a tad oily.  Can't beat the prices for happy hour.  Overall, a fun place. Definitely want to come back and try out other things.  Love the outdoor space!
author: Donna W.

description: When the tap goes out of Lagunitas and the substitute is one of those acidic Sierra Nevada kegs that have been sitting too long, annoying. Couldn't say I stuck around for any food, there's just too many other options out there that have their taps in order.
author: Ben P.

description: I've often craved food from this place since a few years ago. I used to work nearby here and it was a common place me and friends went to for lunch. I wasn't expecting much when I first came here but the food was always delicious. I often got the chicken wrap with fries. Oh the fries.. perfectly thin crisp fries.. My mouth is watering thinking of the delicious food I used to eat here back in the day.
author: Rehana K.

description:
Looks tiny from the outside but is a lot bigger once you're in, thanks to the patio that extends out from the bar. 

Reasonably priced drinks and solid tacos on the menu. Pretty good but will be checking out other bars - didn't wow me enough to be a 'must go again'.
author: Lisette P.

description:
Here's my review of the bar scene.

Mars Bar is outside of the trendy districts so you won't find a packed house. It's a nice joint for those looking to get out of the house, sit back and have a drink.

Mars Bar feels like a retrofitted house. I don't think they even have a sign. Keep a look out for solid red circles and metal doors. The floor plan is similar to a capital "U." The first leg is the bar area the entire bar area with seating. The second leg is the small dance floor. Adjacent to the second leg is an outdoor area with tables and outdoor heaters. The outdoor area is fairly large and can seat about sixty people if you really pack it. There's no music here so you can actually have a conversation.

I couldn't drink that night so I really can't comment. I hear the drinks aren't bad. The dj for the night wasn't good. It sounded like he was playing one song over and over with the exception of a Radiohead interlude. There's a bathroom near the digital jukebox.
author: Michael H.

description:
I can't believe Mars Bar has been here the entire time and I never knew.  It's right next to REI and nowhere near any public transport, a bit of a bummer.  But the place is so cool.  

There's a bar area with tables to eat, about the size of most places in the Mission.  But then go around the back and there's another room!  With a pool table.  And the best bit is there's an outdoor patio which they heat very well so that you can be outside in a t-shirt and not feel the chill.
author: Jean K.

description: Man, I was hoping this would be affiliated with the now-demised Mars Bar in Manhattan, endearingly nicknamed the worst bar in NYC. Imagine my disappointment when I walked into Mars Bar and found it was a charming place with cheery locals, clearly an after-work pub for the tech set working nearby. The bartender was quite friendly, and we had a nice conversation about why dark turn-my-face-inside-out beers are gross (see my review of 21st Amendment), and even let me slide on the minimum charge amount of credit cards. It was a quick stop, and I didn't get to sample the kitchen yet, but my kickball league uses this as their after game bar, so I know I'll be back!
author: Kevin B.

description: Had the steak sandwich and an IPA. Sitting on the patio on a sunny day. Steak was super tender and the roll was so fresh and soft. Great price for the quality, really friendly staff. I think I have a new favorite when I'm in the area.
author: j s.

description:
Got here early on a wednesday night - around 5pm. It was easy to find seating outside, and it was a gorgeous day, so that was perfect.

Service was excellent, beer was cold. I was a happy bunny.
author: Kym P.

description: Not a big menu, but a tasty one. My friend went in for a casual lunch and beer and were treated like regulars in this rather down-home place. My burger was among the best I've had in the city, and my friend's ahi tuna sandwich looked just as good. Surprise? Not too painful on the pocketbook! Check it out.
author: Octavio S.

description:
Two words: JELLO WRESTLING.

Mars Bar is no stranger for hosting this extremely creative event for fundraising. I know more than a couple people who have used the back patio at Mars Bar to set up a kiddie pool, thrown it on a couple mattresses, filled it with jello, and hosted a match! And the parking lot in the back was prime for washing off the jello with a hose. These guys have it down pact!

I may or may not have participated in said activity so tequila shots were more than necessary. The bartender was awesome and poured us a couple stiff vodka tonics too.
author: Brianna H.

description:
This place is incredible! The food is great, there are lunchtime specials--except on Thursday (?)....there're tables if you don't feel like eating at the bar, an outdoor patio, pool table, and the bartender, Jane, made a Margarita that was not to be believed....Everybody there is really friendly, so it's easy to hang and chat, or just be in your own little world cuz no one will bother you. Perfect balance!

Definitely coming back here--probably more frequently than would really be good for me.
author: Karen M.

description:
What woman is going to argue with two bathrooms for girls? TWO. 

Huh? 

Not I!

Add in cool bartenders, bouncers without that "I'm the man and you're not" attitude, nice prices, good tunes, and dancing. 

P.S. Birthday and holiday parties there are a blast.
author: Helen K.

description:
I came for the drinks only, and not the food.  When I was there, I remember a cute bartender.  Not sure if he's still around though.

What's cool is that they have a DJ spinning, so you can dance your ass off if you want.  The not so cool thing is that there is so little space to dance. If you can finally get those pool players to stop monopolizing the area, then you can shove that table over and give yourself more dancing space.

Oh yes, there's an outdoor patio too.  Overall, nothing really fabulous for me to rave about here, but it was a cool place to hang out that night with friends and get my dance groove on.
author: Teri C.

description:
Unfriendly. Rude. Condescending!

New Year's Eve.  Excited to ring it in at Mars bars but absentmindedly and regrettably forgot my ID!  Granted I normally look like a 15 year old, on New Years Eve, I had so much make up on, I could have passed as a 90 year old call girl on Broadway.  

In a nutshell, I thought I'd simply try my odds at getting into the bar by simply explaining my situation, completely prepared to cab home to get my ID.  The result of my humble, potential time-saving attempt was mockery and getting called the "s" word - and it certainly wasn't said with a smile.  "SWEETIE?!"  The only person with license to call me that is my great grandmother who wouldn't even say it in English.  

To add insult to injury, after I came back, ID in hand, Oscar insisted on putting a damper on my last day of 2009 by asking me if I had left my "bitchy attitude" at home.  O.O  !

Well I never....

....will find myself subjected to Oscar's condescending behavior again!

One additional star for the Tokyo Teas.
author: Jane L.

description:
Excellent bar to hang out with friends on a Friday or Saturday night. Enjoy the patio outside on warm summer nights, but get there early because it gets really crowded.  Props to the bartender who made strong, but tasty "sex on the beach" and lemon daiquiris for us!  Lorelei (sp?), you are the bomb!  Location is a bit out of the way for me, but it's a good place to hang out after seeing a Giants game!  

Will definitely go back here again soon :-)!
author: Celeste M.

description:
Cool joint, very laid back and not at all pretentious. 

Happy hour is awesome - great drink and food specials. The pulled pork sliders were really tasty paired with the Blue Moon beer they have on tap.

The servers were fast and friendly and the house DJ was spinning some pretty decent sounds. 

Great place to hang out with friends!
author: Christy L.

description:
This place is always relaxing and unpretentious, granted I've only been here a couple of times. 

Have been meaning to spend a nice sunny afternoon in the patio.  Will have to do it soon!
author: Manuel R.

description:
Meh is right.... this place just wasn't doin it for me.

The crowd was super mixed.  There were quite a few older patrons, some hippies, a few crackheads, some bitchy ghetto drunk chicks (always gotta have a few of those lingering at the bar), and a few normal looking people.

Our girl's friend was promoting there that night so we though we should be polite and have at least one drink.  It was painful... I will most likely not be coming back.  At least the hippies had a good time jumping around like wild monkeys to those bongo drum things.....
author: Angela W.

description:
It's a cute little place, but boy oh boy were the drinks awful. I think it was just one particular bartender, actually, so maybe they're okay if you studiously avoid the brunette in the sweater dress (right, she might not be wearing a sweater dress when you go in. Does she LOOK like she'd wear a sweater dress? It takes a special kind of lady). The gin and tonics tasted like 7 Up and she somehow made a salty dog taste...wrong. Three ingredients. Not much room for error. And then the well drinks were $7, not $5 as reported in other reviews. Man, my night is starting to retroactively suck, the more I think about this bum bartender.

No, it was actually a really good time. Aside from nightmare-sweater-dress-bartender, I really enjoyed the bar. Cute back patio, great dancefloor, nice ambiance. Recommended for if you're already in the area.
author: J N.

description: The outdoor area was the only good part of this bar, though they were blasting the heat even though it was one of SF's rare warm nights when I went.  For a while, despite having a full house, there was only one bartender and she was AWFUL.  She's a short-haired white woman and I have to say that at least 3 of my friends independently talked about awful she was, so I was glad I wasn't alone in my poor treatment.  Not only were her drinks very, very weak, but she gave me the wrong about change (and took over 10 minutes to correct it), and she often passed over men waiting for drinks to serve women who had been standing there for a shorter period of time.
author: Ryan S.

description:
friendly staff,
they did not have enough bar staff,only 2 so 10-15  minute wait for drink
prices are high,$6 for beer and glasses were small about 12 oz and they did not fill them to the top,its in a not so great area,they kick you out early about 1.30

not enough bathrooms,1 for the mens total,so its a long wait I have never seen so few in a bar ever,

they turn heat off in patio early so it gets pretty cold outside,they should leave the heat on


seems to turn into a gay bar after 12,first time I have seen a straight bar turn gay after 12

2 djs music was quite good


bar is quite small so its lucky most people were outside on the patio

manager and staff were nice

the few women that were there were out of luck as the men seemed to be trying to hook up with each other men

you can book the place for partys

they badly need more mens toilets
author: cc c.

description:
Came here for happy hour last Friday and it was packed! I quickly found a table though, and our server was quick to greet us. My cousin and I ordered two Hefs, Chardonnay, and two ahi tuna salads (which were really fresh and delicious). The music was good and the crowd was friendly. 

With my $25 restaurant.com certificate that I bought for $10, the total bill was only $19 - awesome! I will most definitely be back!
author: Mariela D.

description: Decent taps, pretty good food and friendly down to earth staff. I often come here to get a drink right after coming from Caltrain. I even came here for the last game of the World Series and it was packed -- and who i think is the owner scrambled to the back room to find us some chairs to sit because the rest were all taken. Nice people for sure. Outdoor patio looks warm and welcoming as well. I'm a fan!
author: Josh K.

description:
I had a damn fine burger here the other night. It was perfectly charred, nice and pink in the center and didn't even need cheese. Hmmm... I could go for another one right about now...

I liked the calamari here too, and the chicken nachos are super fine.

damn, I am hungry...
author: Holly C.

description:
Mars is a cool spot.  In an area of SoMa that has a mix of warehouses, lofts and not too many bars and restaurants, this is a good choice.  I was actually here for dinner and it was good - we shared an order of cheese quesadillas, each had side salads and each had a cheeseburger.  Usually at bars, the booze is always better than the food, but in this case, they actually made an effort.  The burger was juicy and tasty in a nice brioche bun.  The waitress was nice and friendly and made for a pleasant experience.  The price point was good too - most items were under $10.00.

The place itself is relaxed and has a pretty decent mix of people: hipsters, hippies and yuppies.  It's not a pretentious spot and is the kind of place you go to with a group of friends for a relaxing evening or the start of a crazy one.  

I was there during one of those cold, frosty July evenings in SF, but during the warmer weather I'd like to try the outdoor patio that looks pretty awesome.
author: Ken G.

description: Killer food, amazing little space with outdoor area, and a DJ spinning house music all the time.  I'm in heaven.
author: Phillip S.

description: Love love love Mars Bar - they are my go to spot for hosting large groups/birthday parties want to put up your own decorations, have a dedicated space for your group, and not pay any booking fee.  Jenny at Mars Bar is super friendly and accommodating.  My boyfriend and I each had our 30th birthday parties here and the experience was beyond stress-free.  We could drop off our decorations early, storing ice cream cake was not a problem, and best of all, everyone had a great time!  The pool table, outdoor heated patio, very reasonably priced drinks, and great music from the DJ all add up to a guaranteed fun time!
author: Nakissa G.

description: Mar's bar has become my new go-to happy hour location since moving offices. The food is good and they have a great heated patio. I have tried the quesadilla, the tacos, the nachos, and the potato skins. (The potato skins are not on their usual menu, we had a happy hour catered here one time for work, and they served them at the happy hour.)  Everything I have tried has been pretty decent. My favorite were the potato skins I just wish they were available on the regular menu. At about 5pm the DJ starts and its can get a little loud in there, if you want to carry on a conversation I recommend grabbing a seat on the patio if there are any available.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Not only does this place have great music and drinks, but it has great food too. So you can have dinner and go dancing all at the same place, and parking is usually easy to find nearby on the street.
author: a f.

description: We went on a 49er game day just looking to get a bite to eat as there was no where to sit or get fed at any of the surrounding sports bars.  As soon as we walked in we were ushered to a booth seat by the attentive owner (though it was pretty close quarters with some other football fans) and ordered some food.  The pizza and buffalo wings were delicious and they had set up the back room with couches and recliners and extra tables for the game.  Definitely a fun game day spot, the crowd was really friendly and the owner was mingling with the crowd and giving out free drink tickets to people who had been hanging around for a long time, plus they had a DJ for commercial breaks.  I would certainly go back!
author: Katie S.

description:
A great spot for lunch or an after work beverage and casual dinner. Really friendly staff, laid back but good service. Jane and Amber and the lovely waitstaff and bar staff always makes me feel at home. 

Great burgers - really great - and good lunch specials. excellent outside seating and good heaters on cool evenings. DJ can be a little loud if you want to talk, but its not hard to find a more quiet spot in the Mars Bar. 

this place is exactly what you're looking for in a local hangout. Nice staff, good service and very decent food and beverage prices and selections. 

Woof
author: JX C.

description:
I really like this bar- we went there on a tuesday it 
was great for tacos & tecates... great price as well. 
 
I also like that there was parking available and close to the freeway and caltrains....  

 I totally recommend this place for Happy Hour & lunch!!!
author: Julia A.

description:
Have I mentioned that I love Mars bar?! I LOVE MARS BAR! 
They have great (I MEAN GREAT) food for dinner (try the Ahi burger with Wasabi - holy crap, it clears my sinuses) and great cocktails and beers on tap. And there is always music playing, sometimes DJ ALLIER spins for Happy Hour, too (my fave).
They have outdoor seating for smokers and for the warn summer nights, too.  This is going on my list...
author: Alyssa Z.

description: Yeah. This place is a locals hit! Bar tenders are fun. DJ was a grandpa but he played some good old house music mixed with the outside portion. Fun place gets packed and hopping around 11! HIT IT WITH A MARS BAR!
author: Sara N.

description: Good music nice crowd but fix the beer fridge. The bottle beers are just above room temp.  Sat at a table would of been nice if staff would of asked if we wanted to eat... :(
author: Yessica V.

description: This place is great... great staff, friendly bartenders, lots of space, good food and the owners are awesome people who are committed to great customer service. They also have a weekly event on Sundays starting in the afternoon with a really good dj and a spectacular crowd! The vibe is fun, chill, and folks are dancing and hanging out in the back patio under the warm sunshine or watching the game and grubbin inside at the bar or by the pool table. Great place to bring a group of friends to just hang out and have a good time.
author: Karen S.

description:
I love Mars Bar & Restaurant because it's the real deal.  Great food and drinks for people with smiles, frowns and even occasional crowns like the Great and Wonderful Juanita More who does her annual fried chicken extravaganza here to raise money for HIV/Aids, and it's like a circus of love, grub and warm hearts all sharing generously together.  
Mars Bar is a corner joint with no pretense, but always a hint of suspense.  A great old bars says Hi as you enter and you immediately feel at home, hungry and thirsty for the good and hearty food and drinks.  Today they were featuring $2.00 Carnitas Tacos and 2$ Tecate.  But I'm here for my Mars burger fix, and whoa here it comes, pretty as a blonde at the circus.  
Jane just placed my big, juicy burger and mound of hot crispy thin fries down, so I'll report back after taking that 1st mouthwatering bite.  Oh God that tastes good.  The bun is great, and it's perfectly toasted while the huge premium meat patty is seared to perfection and juicy pink inside.  A generous slice of red onion, cold leaf of Romain and a tomato slice bring it all to sublime sweetness then you've got a huge handful of fries to die for.  
My day is made, happiness takes over my full face and tummy as my mood grows light and cheery.  Thank you Jane and Mars Bar for a day changing lunch break.  I love Mars Bar and their AAA burger.
author: Stu S.

description: Came here for Happy Hour on a Thursday night.  Servers are friendly.  Drink menu is cheap.  Small menu of food but it was pretty good and reasonable.  Has an outdoor patio.  Crowd is laid back.  Very cool spot!
author: Diana M.

description: Decent bar food is always a nice surprise. I actually had a bit of trouble deciding from their menu, but finally landed on the chicken sandwich on a baguette. It was very tasty. The atmosphere was fun, and they had sectioned off the back side booths for our group (came with a bunch of coworkers). The outdoor patio area looked great, next time I come here I'll definitely have to check it out. The pool table kept us entertained while waiting for our food, though it was a bit janky. All in all though Mars Bar is a pretty good spot for lunch with friends in SOMA.
author: Krista S.

description:
It's all about the $2 tacos and $2 Tecates on Tuesdays!  

That's all I've tried here but it's great!
author: Cindy A.

description: Fun place.  Nice Patio.  Good drinks and decent pool area.  Perfect for a nice afternoon.  I've been going for years and always found the service and quality to be pretty consistent.
author: Matthew T.

description:
I love Mars Bar! It's honestly one of my favorite bars in the city. It does not cater to pretentious crowd which absolutely what I look for in a bar. They've always got a great DJ lineup which draws a crowd of people that love dancing and good music. This makes for an overall good atmosphere. 

Their Sunday brunch menu is very tasty too. They've got great happy hour specials on food and drinks. Right now, they offer Monday Night $2 Budwiser/Budlight Special for the football season.

I've never had a hard time parking around Mars Bar, which is such an incentive to come here. The bar staff fast and friendly. The security staff is always on point, so you never have to worry about creepy guys or a rowdy crowd when you come here. I really like the heated patio, so you can take a breather from dancing and chat with friends.

This bar just rocks!
author: Danielle S.

description:
This place rocks for happy hour! The best part is the outdoor patio for sure. They have heat lamps so you'll never be cold in the chilly SF weather. The drinks are reasonablhy priced and it's a very laid back crowd. I love coming here and sitting outside on a Friday evening. 

I've also come here on a Saturday night where the experience was a quite a bit different. There was a cover charge for the DJ and the crowd was more dressed up being a Saturday night. They don't serve food on the weekend which is a bummer because there isn't really anything nearby to grab a bite that's quick. 

Personally - I wouldn't come back on a weekend night as I wasn't into paying a cover at  a bar that I consider to be a more chill place. I love happy hours though and I'll keep coming back.
author: Lindsay A.

description:
Let's just start with understanding this- I like the night life. I like to boogie. Mars Bar made that happen. 
I was invited out to a birthday shindig for a pair of party goers of the Aquarian persuasion who apparently are regulars here. A friend of a friend had a crew dj'ing some house music that night, and while I may not be a house expert, who can really tell after four (or seven) glasses of champagne WHAT you're listening to!? Not me... and that is evident if you've ever seen me at a wedding. 
The place got pretty crowded, but everyone was pretty mellow. Loved the patio. It's always nice to bust out of a hot crowded place and get some fresh air and catch some fresh faces for people watching before you go hunting for your unattended beverage inside.
I found the drinks not to be insulting and over the top expensive, and they were generous pours. I hear this place is Niner bar, so hey, that makes it great in my book anyhow. I want to get back for some of the pub-fare, and think that I will be returning soon.
author: Kelly B.

description:
Mars is like dating.  In the beginning, it is so much fun! It's so cool to hang out. Over time, the bliss is over.  It becomes just down right annoying and you don't want to be seen there. 

One the plus side, the bartenders and the bouncers are awesome. I love the outdoor patio.  And sometimes the pool table can be used. 

Just come here if you want to sit, grab a cocktail, and catch up with an old friend.
author: Val B.

description: Terrible service, they forgot our order and after asking several times if they could check on it they didn't do anything. We waited 50 minutes for food. Also, the beer tasted like cigarettes.
author: Scott N.

description:
I usually have an OK time here, wanting to leave within a few hours of arriving at the latest.  I decided to write about this place though because of my experience there last Sunday.  I gave a $20 bill for a drink to a bartender, some blond chick, during an all day house music party.  I was catching up with an old friend that I haven't seen in 10 years at the time.  Some time passed and she didn't bring back the change so I asked her about it.  She said she had put the change down in front of me but immediately went to the tip jar to pull out my change.  I looked her right in the eye and I knew that she thought I was too wasted to notice that I didn't get my change.  Beeatch.

I wouldn't give a lousy review just for one retarded bartender - the city is full of them.  But there is something about certain places in the city, especially night clubs, that just turn me off.  I've tried to have a good time here on several occasions but have never been successful - I think it may just be the energy of the place.
author: Nathan V.

description:
Great place to hang out or a stop a long the party path.

Plenty of street parking makes this an ideal location = star
Cheap drinks and eat = star
Tons of seating inside and a great outdoor patio with heaters= star
Cool bartenders, waitstaff and DJ = star

Ditch the overpriced snooty bars. Come out to hang out at this kewl joint!
author: Christine T.

description: I give respect to any place in SOMA that's got a neighborhood spot feel.  Patio, friendly staff, pool table, decent tap.  I've only been to Mars on weekdays after work, and it usually is a solid option.
author: Bill H.

description:
Back in the day, when I first moved into this neighborhood, one could go to Mars bar on a lazy Wednesday (hey! I remember moving in on a Wednesday in 2000!) and hear people have a power lunch over things like "hits per day" and "eyeballs".  

Whatever, for me it was just close to the train and gave me a short walk to my transportation, and on weekends, the closest anyone has ever lived to the Mars Bar (unless of course, some of the bartenders live there.  Sure, I KNOW a couple people have spent the night there.  (Hell, a couple bartenders spent the night at my place, but we're keeping all that out of it!), but still, as far as living on a day to day basis, this was my local bar, and no one was closer.  Well, except for #55.

Anyway, strange night.  Some weird a$$holes hanging out at the bar next to us.  We paid them no mind, except for the excessive spilling, which was right out of a pre-teen chat room:

I was all like "hey, watch it!"

he was all like "watch what?!?"

I was like "you know!"

he was like "I'm drinking!"

I was like "OMG! that's the problem"

he was like "I am going to front like i am a tough guy that weighs 150lb., but seriously, do you want to go home with me?"

and I was like "you're gross!"

At least, that's how I remember it, but i think someone slipped some 90210 into my last drink so my recollection may be affected by an inflection.
author: Kevin N.

description:
Went here last night after the St. Vincent de Paul's Discarded to Divine charity fashion show and auction at 888 Brannan.  I had low expectations, mainly due to its name, which this place happens to share with what is probably the dirtiest bar in Manhattan.  

Overall the place was pretty cute.  Nice front room with tables and booths, and a spacious back patio with heat lamps and lots of greenery.  Drinks were on par, but we were disappointed that the kitchen had closed at 9 pm.   So I made the executive decision that we'd have to cab it over to 15 Romolo in search of late night pulled pork sliders.  Mmm! 

Good place for a quick drink in the area, and was much easier to catch a cab from here than from the mob-scene post a large event at 888 Brannan.
author: Jaimie M.

description:
$5 well drinks and $2 Carnitas Tacos (really, really yummy) on Tuesdays. The waitstaff was attentive and the atmosphere casual but cool. 

The facade could use some sprucing.
author: Michelle Y.

description: Great bar on a thursday afternoon! Beers are fine, food is meh. But the atmosphere is really cool. Good music, nice people. Great bar for after work.
author: Francesca C.

description: My re-defacto (re-defacto = my default spot for boozing again) spot for a pint or a spirit or two or three or four.  Off the beaten path bar and restaurant, perfect for reminiscing with old pals and office mates.  Awesome happy hour, good pub grub, kick arse ambiance, with chill patio.  Check it out.
author: Jason T.

description:
After reading the Yelp reviews, I decided to go here with some friends for some food and a round of drinks.  Bad decision.  I tried to order the wings, but they were out.  Then I tried to order a burger with blue cheese, but they were out of blue cheese.  Fair enough, maybe all the blue cheese disappeared with the wings, so I chose pepperjack.  In the end, the burger lacked flavor.  Inn and out would have been WAY better than the $12 this burger cost.

Maybe at least a solid Lagunitas IPA would satisfy me.  No luck there either.  The IPA was flat, warmer than normal serving temp, and had a strange acidic aftertaste.  I thought maybe they'd just changed the keg and forgot to purge the line after having a cider in-line, but the bartender said the keg wasn't freshly tapped.  So... I ordered one of their signature cocktails, the Bulleit Mule. Whisky, ginger beer, and lime.  Simple enough. I've made it at home myself.  A goto drink.  Not at this bar.  The ginger beer in the mule tasted like a terrible Walmart generic soda, and the whiskey was not even detectable.  

Oh, and did I mention it took 30 minutes for the kitchen to make my burger... On a Monday night, with maybe 5 other people eating in the place.  The complaints go on and on.
author: Greg K.

description:
I like me a chatty bartender. I also like me a bartender who waits until he turns his back to you to roll his eyes when you order a mojito. That kind of bartender is ALL class. 

The bartenders here are real slices of sweet potato pie. None of them seem to have that ever-so-popular bartender chip-on-the shoulder. None of them scoff at you for ordering a drink that takes 20 minutes to make. And for the most part, they look like hot Mission boys with hair that needs to be washed and 5 o'clock shadows. And I like hot Mission boys with a little funk on the side. They make me want to  take them to my favorite used bookstore and read Wilde to them as we drink iced Mochaccinos and trade fedoras.

The heat lamps are space-agey and give the outdoor patio a bit of a Jetsons feel....which goes hand in hand with the name of the bar. I kind of wish they had Daughter Judy and Jane his Wife cardboard stand-ups, but I do understand that some people may find those a little tacky. If you're one of THOSE, you better stay away from my apartment. Ya.

The patio is great, and despite the fall chill in the air, it stayed smoldering (perhaps a bit too smoldering. My face started to melt a little) and comfy....although when I got home my hair smelled like I washed it with cigarette ash shampoo and dirty martinis.

Mars is a tad on the far side (HA! Mars, get it? The planet! Cause it really is far! Ya, wow) for me to make regular visits to, but I'm more then willing to haul my cookies out there for special occasions, especially if a special blond siren continues to offer me her chauffeur services, and if they promise to play House of Pain and Chris Cross again.

I didn't try much of the food there, just the Caesar salad rolls, which were tasty and all, but I'm still offending my co-workers with my garlic breath...which is one of my favorite pass-times! Way to go Mars! 

-1 point for tacking a 5 cent charge on to the $2 service charge to use the ATM. Five cents? really? you need to do that?
author: Sammy S.

description:
I am not a dumb girl. 

So, when I saw this place was called Mars and they were open to the public for the purpose of making money I assumed there must be Roman Gods here, big strong ones who were all into war and shit. That is hot. But, nope, when I went I didn't run into that hot Roman hunk Mars. I have run into several cool bartenders and DJs that are a step away from being Gods, though I am not certain they are of Roman descent.

So, I went home and I re-thought things. I figured if they weren't referring to the Roman God then surely they must be referring to the candy bar that they stopped selling in the US many years ago. Yes, that made sense seeing as it is called Mars Bar. I was going to get me some retro chocolate, or at the very least the slightly different,.....oh hell,  lets hype it up and call it exotic.......candy bar they still sell in the UK. I was wrong again, no candy bar. There is a pool table, but I guess a pool table is nothing like a candy bar. There is also pretty good pub fare, but again, not a candy bar. 

So I tried a third time to understand why this place is called Mars and BINGO, I got it!!! It is clearly named after the planet. There was a time when Mars was thought to have liquid, and this bar definitely has liquid. Mars is in outer space, and at Mars there is an outdoor space. Mars is known as the red planet and the small dance floor has some red lights. It all makes sense! 

See, I am not a dumb girl at all.
author: Drue C.

description:
How to turn a one star experience into three?  Happy bartenders!  Mars was packed last night (pre Thievery Corporation) and the staff was completely overwhelmed.  That being said, the bartenders busted their asses and did their best to take care of everyone, even when the power went out (another good reason to pay with cash)
My food order was 'lost' but the manager made amends by buying me a beer.  Again, no attitude, but a sincere apology.
And a quick bit of bar etiquette-  
1)  If the bar is packed and bartenders are slammed don't order mojitos.  Please.
2)  Would it kill you to order a bottled beer when the bar is out of pint glasses?
3) Waving your hand in the bartender's face and screaming "Make me a mojito!" is not cool.  I'm surprised he didn't kick your ass out of the bar.
author: phil h.

description: This place was ok. You need a cover charge to get in. But they did let our party of 6 get in free. We sat in the outside patio section. It was nice out. The only thing is if you don't smoke cigarettes, you will get a ton of people smoking while your trying to eat. The food was ok. I ordered a pull pork sandwhich. Thenprok was well seasoned but they don't give you that much pork and seems like u get more bread the pork. It was suppose to be served with coke slaw, but they ran out so they have us more fries. That sucked! The service was very slow but I'm not gonna hate because it is a very busy spot.
author: Lay Lay G.

description:
What else to say about Mars bar that hasn't been said? Oh! I know. Don't plan on doing anything naughty in the stall of the girl's room. The door is like one of those Old-Western saloon doors, affording little privacy and even less noise-muffling. So do your contraband and engage in public sexytime in the privacy of your car or just exercise some self control and wait til you get home (minus one star). 

Aside from that, Mars Bar ROCKS! I love this place. The barstaff and owner are efficient and friendly and awfully good looking. Drinks are generous and high-octane. There are three, count 'em, THREE bars, meaning you're bound to get a drink regardless of how packed the place is. 

There is a front room with a large bar, booths, and tables for dancing on (says me). There is a room next door with a pool table and a bar. If you dance on the pool table, the owner may buy you a shot. There is also a big, huge patio with 180 horsepower heat lamps (you will NOT be cold and you may break a sweat), lots of greenery, and an adorable outdoor bar. This is the ideal place to sip (pound) your cocktails and stare at your love with stars (broken blood vessels) in your eyes. If you're single, this could also be a great place to pick up a cute-ish drunk boy. There are a lot of them and there was a hell of a lot of eyefucking going on both times I was there.
 
Mars is a great place to hang out and imbibe. I can't wait to check out their patio on a sunny day. Despite the out-of-the-way location, it's well worth the trip over. Just make sure to arrange a ride home or call a cab. It can be tricky to flag one down in these here parts.
author: Autumn K.

description: Driven by here many times but never stopped. The giants game just let out and traffic was terrible (when is it not in SF). So we decided to give it a try after reading other reviews. This was a great find. The food was a little on the steep side, but it was very good (nachos and wings). The beer price was average ($4/pint). Friendly and fast service. I'll be back.
author: Craig F.

description:
Satellite's gone way up to Mars, soon it will be filled with parking cars! What?  I always think of that Lou Reed song when I come in here, no real reason except the name, I suppose.

It's hard to believe Mars has been a successful bar longer than I've lived in San Francisco -- maybe its location deep in SOMA makes me forget about it -- but every time I go by, a stellar time is had, and it all makes sense. The indoor front bar is my preferred point of inebriation, but on hot summer nights (or cold ones, they have heat lamps), the outside patio is where it's at. 

And while I like their cocktails, it's Mars' appetizing bar food that really does it for me. Their buffalo wings and nachos have satisfied me on many an occasion, and the former gets pretty darn close to actual Buffalo/Rochester quality (almost is still far off, but almost is something).

And what's this? They serve lunch? Wednesdays are fried chicken and Tuesdays are $2 carnitas tacos & $2 tecates? I need to plan a mission to Mars pronto.
author: Nish N.

description:
I like this place. It's a good neighborhood hangout that's not too sceney. I reminds me of Club Cocomo because it has the outside deck. It gets packed in the main room on a Saturday night so it's cool to have the outside option. 

They seem to have a mixed crowd (yeaaa...I'm not the only black guy in the crowd:) and the bartenders are on it. Folks on the dancefloor are there to throw down and the are no tweakers. 

It's been a favorite of mine for years now and will go back ANYTIME I hear a good dj is rockin' over there.
author: Bill M.

description: The guy bartender made a really good lemon drop.  Overall a decent bar.  It was raining when we went but I'd go back for drinks at the back patio and mess around at the pool table.  Clean bathroom. Plenty of street parking nearby.
author: Sherielyn G.

description:
Mars is like a bad relationship.

I know it doesn't always treat me right.  Mars will let me wait around for twenty minutes before taking my order when I'm down right starving.  It'll give my buddy twice as many fries as it gives me.  It won't even fully cook my sandwich.

But then it says it's sorry.  It tells me it didn't mean it.  It was just busy and understaffed.  It will never happen again.  It pays attention to me.  It fills my water glass religiously, gives me free tunes on the juke box, and it shows soccer on TV.

Just like a bad relationship, no matter how much I keep getting neglected and mistreated... I always look fondly upon the good times.  I keep going back for more.

I think you'll change your ways some day.  I secretly hope if I just love you enough, you'll see how you hurt me and you'll stop.  I hope.

Mars, I love ya baby.
author: Christopher K.

description:
Probably a good place to go when it's not crowded, however, before a big concert across the street....terrible.

Rude service (if at all), slow, slow bartenders and lack of tables made it really unpleasant.

Oh, and to the doorman who called me an "old geezer" in front of the preteen girls coming in as he was busy staring at their pre-pubescent breasts, I have 2 words: statutory rape.
author: Nick R.

description:
My husband and I love Mars!  We would meet up here 1-2x per week for lunch and loved their versatile menu and friendly staff.  

Everything we sampled was tasty--pizzas, sandwiches & my personal fave, their burgers.  We also enjoyed Mars as a safe haven to watch the World Cup in the afternoon...

Parking is less than ideal but overall this is a great place for lunch.
author: Kristie F.

description: Afternoons at Summer Sundays is the only reason I go to Mars Bar, which at night reminds me of too much of the original Stud, minus the bears and twinks. The loud, amazingly diverse crowd that used to cram Liquid and Pink dons shades, spaghetti straps, and open toes for Mars' mimosas and sunshine, on the long patio, right off the dance floor, courtesy of French expat, and former Pink owner, DJ Frankie Boissy. Here you'll find the freaks of the nightlife and music industries, making deals, talking trash, and keeping an eye out on current, former, or future partners. Ahem. There is no better place I know for talent to hook up on a sunny summer afternoon. Mars Bar is not a fancy place, you can go casual, or swank, but do go for the friendly dance groove (house music), and good food, with a full bar. Give Frankie my love.
author: John Z.

description:
I had one of the best birthdays ever here because I was surrounded by the amazing company of friends. Great cozy space, with 3 areas to hang out in: a bar/restaurant, a dance floor, and an open air patio. I loved that the patio had huge heat lamps overhead that kept us warm during the chilly night and allowed us to cool off when the dance floor got too stuffy. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating, and the bartenders kept the drinks fairly priced and flowing (a little too much for this lightweight). At 9pm, the kitchen closed, but they were cool enough to let some friends bring in outside food. Parking was a piece of cake in the neighborhood --- I ended up having to leave my car there overnight and it was exactly the way I left it when I went to pick it up at 9pm the next night. 

Friends, they're the best presents I could ever ask for. Thanks to Mars for providing such a fun spot for me to gather all my wonderful friends together. Extra special thanks to Raoul who played an amazing set that kept everyone dancing all night long. I'm truly a lucky girl ;)
author: Connie C.

description:
Cute and efficient bartenders, industrial strength heaters on the patio, free wireless, good burgers and a full bar?  I need to find a job that lets me telecommute.

When you go, make sure to say hello to Bob The Neighbor.
author: Quinn S.

description:
I went to the Mars Bar for the bartender's going-away party.

There were lots of lights... Bright lights...

Lots of people I knew were there... My friends...

There was music... And dancing... My boyfriend was there and we danced and danced...

The free booze was flowing... And the free food... 

Everyone was having fun...

The weather was perfect... And the patio was full... And colorful, with all those twinkling lights... Full of the laughter of my friends...

The night seemed as though it would never end...

... ... ... ... ... ...

If this sounds like a near-death experience, that might not be a coincidence.

I am very close to checking myself in. It was WEDNESDAY NIGHT. 

AGAIN.

(Good bar. Too bad the bartender went away.)
author: Lisa T.

description:
I don't know to to say about this place. It's cool, I guess. The last time I was here, we celebrated Connie C birthday. That is also where I met Keane for the first time. 

So, really, I had a great experience. I do however think the drinks were a little weak and the cost is as great as my rock and republic jeans. 

Yeah, so last night we said our goodbye to our dear friend, Laura D. 

Au revior, Laura D.
author: Stanley K.

description: I have been going there for years. Its a few blocks from work and all my friends wind up there. I know it very well and will describe it thus, its as if really nice people bought a cool dive bar and made it nice. No bad attitudes here. Its all smiles and staff that seems to care. Good ratio on my Manhattan. Good patio vibe.
author: Steve M.

description:
When I was told we were going to Mars Bar, my first thought was that this was some kind of chocolate/caramel/candy bar themed joint, which seems like a nice idea until the next morning when you've got a stomach ache on top of your hangover. 

Then I thought to myself that it might be Mars Bar as in the planet Mars, making it some kind of astronomy or science fiction themed bar. 

It doesn't appear to be either of these things. I don't know why it's called Mars Bar.

My first impressions were pretty positive, mainly because it was full of people I like and a few I hadn't seen in a long time, and because one of these people bought me a shot of some top shelf tequila. These things may not apply to you.

But whether or not you like the people around you and whether or not one of them buys you a drink, you'll encounter an attentive bar staff and live DJs and a pool table and a large heated patio. There aren't too many cabs in the area, but parking is easy if you can find some poor sucker to play DD for you. These are all good reasons to like Mars Bar even if you don't know why they call it that.
author: matthew r.

description: Great spot, and right around the corner from my friend's house. It's hard to believe that it took me so long to get here. The food is tasty, I really liked the Carnitas Tacos they have on special Tuesdays and the Pulled Pork Sandwich. They've got a pool table, outdoor seating - it's great!
author: Christy Z.

description:
I especially liked this place because parking was plentiful and easy, so easy in fact, that i got a spot right in front of the bar. That's something that'll probably never happen at any other club in the city.

Big space, friendly people, great drinks, nice bartenders - this place is a sure thing.
author: Richard T.

description:
Outside seating... Heat lamps... Good beer on tap... Divey... Good music... Pool table... 

I love this place...
author: Jen D.

description:
Along with a bunch of friends, I hit up Mars one Friday night after a hard day at work. We went in for dinner and snagged a big corner booth near the pool tables and chowed on some surprisingly good bar food. I had a pizza with pep and shared some mozzarella sticks--yes, starting off the night healthy! My friends also ordered buffalo wings and a salad. Both were good. Actually, pretty darn good for standard bar food.

Later we settled into the outside patio and ordered a smorgasbord of drinks--Amstels, lemon drops, Ketel One, Dewers--from the smaller bar. The bartender, Lorelei, was very cool and friendly, giving us a few on the house towards the end of the night. (Not that we needed it at that point.) 

Needless to say, I got fairly soused and had a great time. Mars Bar is a perfect place to hang out at with a group. There's an abundance of space and the atmosphere is mellow. The crowd is sort of an eclectic mix: some SOMA creatives, dot-com types, construction workers, and biker dudes, but who ever you happen to be, you'll feel at home.
author: Patrick G.

description:
Mars Bar has a strange place in my heart.  That bar is connected to a couple of my romances back in 2001.   I actually haven't gone back since then but how could I say no to Connie C?

Mars Bar hasn't changed much.  The place is still bumpin' and the bartenders are still very nice and attractive.  They made really good use of a small area and the outdoor heaters are big and encompass a lot of area to take the chill out of the air. Great place for a big group to party.  

Props to the bartender who accidentally rung up the wrong card and quickly fixed the problem with ease and a smile.  Also for being a heavy pour...I love that in a bartender.
author: Jay H.

description:
The bartenders here rock! Even when slammed, the folks behind the bar are composed, friendly, warm and pour well. The owner is such a hottie, and warm and gracious to boot.

I really like the space - clean,  comfortable and casual without being divey (although I do like divey too!). As others have said, it looks small and intimate, but boy they can pack em in and still have plenty of breathing room.

I look forward to my next visit for sure.
author: Lise L.

description:
Must be named "Mars Bar" for it's location... or maybe I just like things that are closer to my own neighborhood. What ever the reason, I can't think of anything bad to say about Mars Bar - cool patio, good atmosphere, they serve alcohol which helps you make inappropriate decisions. Does everything a bar is supposed to do. 

I can't really think of anything great to say about it either, which is why the 3 stars. It is a bar - I wouldn't go out of my way (or on the 27) to go here on a Friday night, or plan a birthday party here, but I am not opposed to going when a group of my fellow yelper friends are saying good bye to Laura D!
author: Jessica R.

description:
If you're about to about to experience the ABSOLUTE SUCK that is the SF Concourse Exhibition Center for a concert, you'd better get your drink on here.

Mars Bar was actually the highlight of my night.  A group of 4 of us was able to walk in and actually get a seat at the bar, where we proceeded to see bartenders taking shots of tequila and watch them stumble around trying to make our drinks.  Pure comedy - unless you're thirsty, then it's just a little foolish.

The best part of the night is when we ordered food from the (surprisingly diverse) menu.  There was one scared-as-hell cook in the back trying to churn out food for what seemed to be a neverending stomach of masses.  The food took about 1hr to come out, and when it did, they'd left off one of our main courses.  Explanation: we don't have any more of that.  Well, thanks for telling us AFTER the food has been delivered.  We ended up going to the cook directly and having him fix us some fantastic off-the-menu concoction... Redemption.  (In a slightly off-topic story, I think the cook had a mental breakdown and left 20 minutes later, because the door to the kitchen shut and the light went off!)

Anyway, I'd probably go back - the drinks were good and the staff was friendly (being inebriated helps)...
author: Brett L.

description:
As the only non-smoker in a group of smoker friends, I am frequently abandoned at bars left to watch tables, bar stools, drinks, jackets, etc. while my friends go and satisfy their nicotine cravings. That's why I love bars with outdoor seating -- it's the one time that I can go out with friends and not be left alone for half the evening warding off drunkards trying to steal our chairs. The Mars Bar has an awesome outdoor seating area complete with heat lamps for those chilly nights. 

The entrance to the bar makes it seem deceptively small, but turn the corner and there is plenty of room. Bartenders are fast, friendly, and efficient and the drinks are reasonably priced. If this bar was a little bit closer to my apartment, I might become a regular.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Great place to host an event.

Jenny the owner and the rest of the staff really helped out a lot when we decided to throw an indoor/outdoor party for 250 people, with live music and DJs.  Great venue, service and drinks. We hope to do it again there next year.  

-Boss Hog
author: c g.

description:
This used to be the place to be during web 1.0. I recall the music pumping, girls with their high heels lined up across the bar dancing to James Brown and cocktails flowing. Now that my office is around the corner, I can see it being a nice lunch spot.  So far I have enjoyed the fish and chips. It hit the spot. I have also enjoyed the meatloaf that was wonderfully seasoned. 
I have a feeling that happy hour could turn into an episode of west side story. It's definitely a whole of landscape of SOMA.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Get the Patrón Margarita

I had 1.........2...........urrr maybe 30.................ok it was closer to 30

don't remember much about that night except they're hella good.


Cool place to chill
author: Steve K.

description:
I had never experienced a concert at the Design Center Concourse, and I sure as hell didn't know where to go or what to do beforehand in no man's land SoMa. So, before I had to deal with an all ages show for Rilo Kiley (read: annoying Marina hair flipping girls and lanky boys in flannels) I needed a brew and some sustenation to endure the 4 hours I would be standing. 

Looks like men AND women are from Mars...pretty cool and chill crowd. Outdoor seating make me very happy, although there was none left for me or my friends. We had a booth in the back--which isn't the best for service. You have to make yourself known or you can end up sitting there for 20 minutes with no beer in hand and a sad face.

Good bar food, drinkies and a decent DJ. I think that night he pretty much played everything from my collective's collection at the table. I could see myself hanging out here for a weeknight, but not really make the trip out there for the weekend.
author: Jessica P.

description:
WHAT WHAT WHAT!  I cant here you, Im having way to much of a good time to even care what your saying!

Thats about the jist of my great night at Mars Bar.  Coming from L.A. to visit the fellow SF yelpers couldnt have been more fun.  And doing it up at the Mars Bar was the highlight of the weekend.  But like most bars, the crowd and the friends you are with usually end up telling the story of how good a night you are going to have, regardless of what the location provides.  Now when the location provides

1) A good dance floor
2) A good out door indoor area
3) A good vibe
4) An AWESOME bartender (Christopher...I hope I spell his name right)
5) A good look

Your gauranteed to have a good time.  And this place has it all and more then that, makes me can't wait to get back up to SF.
author: Antonio A.

description:
When I first checked out Mars Bar on Yelp, I thought that this was going to be some swanky little wine bar that my friends had picked out to go to. Once again, dragging me away from my dive bar safety net. When I walked in through the solid-looking metal doors (which reminded me of the Endup, sending a quiver of fear down my spine as I anticipated the scene unfolding in front of me) - I was a little surprised. It's a bar. It's not upmarket, it's not dive, it, well, hovers between the two. 

Bar measures were reasonable and not too killer - but there seemed to be only one barman serving - on a Saturday night... which swiftly became busy. It became a mission of plan ahead - get halfway down and buy another drink - 20mins later, and the rest of your drink gone, your frequent flier miles have gone up and the unlucky person who went to the bar has a 50/50 chance of actually making it back with a fresh order. 

I do have to clap my hands in congratulation to the Mars Bar for having the best outdoor patio in town. Not only is it decorated in multicoloured lighting (for a drunk person, great! So many things to focus on), there is an outdoor bar and the fattest overhead heater I have ever seen. It looked like some industrial battery farm heater with a heating coil as thick as a soda can. Looked like it was solid - and the heat emanating from it was fantastic. Even better - for a blustery cold night, the patio was completely protected on 3 sides, so you barely noticed a thing. 

There was plenty of seating last night - oddly - the majority of people preferred to stand in the middle between the bar and the seating area - which is fine by me, just seemed strange - like they knew something we didn't. And one last gripe - the music, which was at a reasonable level when we came in went sky-high halfway into the night - so much so it was turned down (I guess we were not the only ones deafened). Seeing as this wasn't a bar with a dance area, it did seem a little incongruous to have such loud music in a bar clearly made for chilling, talking and drinking. Saying that, it did resort us to falling back to the good old 'Name That Tune'  game, which I guess is something.
author: Catriona C.

description:
Why I love Mars Bar: 

1) Good bar food.  Organic meat in a bar? Yes.  AND some of the best fries around.

2) Easy parking.  Always.

3) Friendly bartenders.  They will play dice with you all night if it's not too busy.

4) Outdoor patio.  You know what that means: I can simultaneously wreck havoc on my lungs AND liver.

5) Good selection of booze in case I'm feeling adventurous.

6) Feels like the San Francisco I know and love.  If you were born and raised here too, you know what I mean.

http://www.cleanscores.com/1674/Cafe+Mars
author: Ann W.

description:
We recently came here for my friend's birthday. The place let us bring our own DJ from 9-11 which was pretty cool of them. They were also down if we wanted to bring our own birthday cake. Tasty, tasty. 

When you first walk in, you think "okay, another small, dark bar in the city." But then you realize there's a back room... and then... a patio with another bar station outside. And the patio is pretty sweet (side note: the men's bathroom is out on the patio, took me a few minutes to find it). They had fun summer decorations out, but I'm not sure if they're always up or if it was for the upcoming beach day. 

The drinks are decently priced and tasty. I know many of my friends don't remember the evening very well. Good job, Mars Bar. 

The bartenders were some of the nicest/interactive I've been around: they joked/commented on my roommate's purse, they shook our hands when we left, they suggested fun drinks and they even moved the pool table for us so we could dance in the back room. They were just genuinely nice people. 

Also, this has nothing to do with the Mars Bar, but the taxi driver who picked us up was intense. He drove like a maniac (even for taxi standards). He played his techno music so loud we couldn't talk. He had an earring that flashed different colors. We felt like we were in a rave. 

One star for the ride home; 4 stars for the great service at the Mars Bar!
author: Jared S.

description:
**hiccup**

Oh sorry, I think I am still hungover from the shenanigans of a Saturday night party here this weekend.

Ay dios mio was this place fun. I am guessing it had a lot to do with the group of fantabulous yelpers that came out and all of those Mandarin and 7's with a splash of cranberry, but yes oh yes, a good time was had here!

I liked the fact that the inside was a really warm den of drinkiness and that it also had the outdoor patio area. Made for a nice balance of party spots. I would go back here for sure! Like totally. ;)
author: Stephy S.

description:
Simple, but good food. It's not pretty or trendy, just a modest little restaurant on the corner of a sort of burgeoning little neighborhood South of Market (a.k.a. SOMA). 

My favorite item on their lunch menu: Grilled Ahi Tuna - grilled to order on a toasted sesame seed brioche bun w/ grilled red onions & wasabi aioli (description taken directly from their website); the tuna was perfectly seared and the wasabi aioli added just the right amount of kick.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
It might if had something to do with the special truffles I ate before coming... or the gin tonic flowing steadily through my bloodstream... but I had a ton of fun here. 

It probably had everything to do with being surrounded by some of the coolest yelpers around....

The bartenders and happy, helpful and clearly having fun....and I love love love the outdoor section where smokers can indulge in their nasty habit.

Bravo mars.
author: erica c.

description:
From the outside it looks like a dive, but once inside, not so much.  Stumbled here while looking to get a drink before a show and also to use the restroom.  Upon entering we were pleasantly surprised on the layout of the place.  With every turned corner there were nice surprises, a gaming area and a cool outdoor patio with a tropical theme.  A DJ was spinning laid back tunes and even though it was pretty busy, the well staffed floor seemed to be handling the situation pretty well.

Drinks were nice and not too pricey, and if ever in the neighborhood, I would definitely chill here again.  My only knock was with the outdoor heaters in the patio.  They weren't the typical "lamp-post" style that you commonly see, they were these massive spaceship type that covered practically the entire patio.  These things definitely worked cuz after sitting out in the patio for a while, I started to feel like one of those chickens inside of a rotisserie.  2 more Stellas and my skin would of been golden brown and crispy.
author: D.wight L.

description:
Great burgers and a good selection of beers.  Be careful going on a busy weekday night...they usually have only one bartender and waits can be long (especially if you're a dude).  Another bad thing if you're a dude...the bathroom is all the way out back in the patio.

UPDATE:  Got a response from the owner so I added a star!  See below..

   i've hated the mens room since the day we got the bar, and it's been a project that has taken me i realize forever to do, but just an FYI, we just started tearing out partitions and re-painting it today and by next week will have it remodeled.  it still sucks that guys have to go outside but at least it won't be as dark and gloomy as it was before!

JENNY
mars bar
author: Mark D.

description: Great party venue! We hosted a party for about 100 at Mars Bar, and it was perfect. The layout of the space is ideal for big groups. Folks can hang out by the bar, dance under the disco ball, or enjoy the warm heat lamps on the spacious patio. We served a variety of heavy appetizers, and many people commented on how good the food was. Jenny and her team handled all the details so we could just enjoy ourselves. We couldn't have chosen a more perfect place.
author: Ann S.

description:
Great Calamari. Awesome Bartenders. Good music. I love their outdoor patio.

One of those places to go on a Monday or Tuesday nite after working your ass off and wanna grip about a coworker. Or, for a Thursday nite...head to Mars for some pre-hardcore-drinking, smoke a little in the open patio, then head out!

Minus one star for not serving food after 9pm. W T F. 

When I drink, I eat.

... so that I can drink more 0=)
author: Hana N.

description:
This venue is really chill, and parking is easy to find (in comparison to other spots).  Happy hour on Fridays is pretty cheap.  I'm from LA, so again, in comparison, it's cheap. $5 for a vodka red bull is a sale.  My friend that lives in SF mentioned that cheap should be $1 for drinks.  I would just feel bad at that point...but still, who can pass up that deal!!  Woowee!  I should ask her where she goes!

The outside patio to this place is heated.  Which fought against pretty chilly weather last Friday.  But I would have been an ice cube without them.

The dance floor seemed pretty large and spacious, especially since nobody was dancing.  But if this place had more people on the dance floor, I would have given it a 5.  I like when people get down.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Went to Mars Bar this past Friday and almost immediately wanted to go venture out to the rest of downtown SF. Just by looking at others' reviews, Mars Bar seems like a favorite, but it just wasn't cutting it for me.

The music was bland and the crowd was sparse, so if you wanted to dance you'd have to be one of those brave souls that stomachs the embarrassment of dancing alone! 

On a brighter note, the bar service was quick and both bartenders that I spoke with were pleasant. My drinks were made strong and tasty, which is always an added treat. An aspect of Mars Bar that I enjoyed was the outdoor seating area; they have fountains that are illuminated by red and blue lights, a surplus of tables, and overhanging heaters that warm you during your socializing in the cool and crisp SF weather. 

Returning to Mars Bar isn't probable for me, I'd rather go explore other joints around downtown.
author: Angelica C.

description:
I am certainly not cheap and don't mind paying for a good cocktail but Mars Bar doesn't come across as a place that should be charging $7 for an Absolut Mandarin.   

Another observation is how the bartender that evening took care of his regular customers. I love that he was attentive to them.  In fact that should always happen, but not at the expense of the new customers.  

A member of my party requested an absolut ruby red and soda.  The drink came and he thought it tasted different but just went ahead and nursed it due to not being able to get the bartenders attention.  He ended up finishing it and ordered another one.  The bartender then told him he was not drinking absolut but a substitute Finlandia.  All well and fine but couldn't you have given the option.  

Onion rings were left in the grease for far too long.  They were like a sponge of Wesson oil.

Ok so maybe I was tired and being a bit bitchy but these are just my honest observations and experiences.  Certainly not writing the place off over one not so great experience.  The space is cool and I do like the back patio.  Although at one point I was sitting and looking around feeling like I was in a double wide trailer.  

Yikes I guess I was having a bad day!
author: Scott P.

description:
No no. This place is fine. Except for that one time when my friends and I stopped in here for a drink and a quick bite and we were invaded! An invasion at a bar with an alien theme. If only...if only the grossest things to walk through those doors had been slimy green purple people eaters from outer space...or even killer clowns from outer space. No. It was a PARTY BUS. Shudder. I can not begin to describe the horror of the bleach blonde, blue-tinted, silver-framed sunglassed sausage fest that still haunts my dreams, but here is a brief excerpt from the HORROR:

Tool: I can't believe you threw ice at me. No woman has ever thrown ice at me.

Me: I don't believe you.

+ 1 star for the waitress who tried (in vain) to rescue us.
author: Melinda B.

description:
GO HERE. This bar/lounge is one of the SF lounge scene's best-kept secrets. 

Mars Bar is tucked away in an odd spot by itself  -- the likelihood of you stumbling across it on the way to somewhere else is about nil. It doesn't look like much from the outside either. Walk in though, and you enter a good-sized room with tables to the left and the bar to the right, and plenty of space to maneuver to the rear, which has a pool table/dance floor area and access to the covered patio in the back. 

Come early on a friday or saturday night, and you'll feel like you're in your neighborhood bar -- there is often an interesting mix of people, from working guys to retirees, and of course . . . with-it people such as yourself. Or me. The door guy and the bartenders are all pretty cool. The music early in the evenings is usually an eclectic mix spiced up with mid-70's funk. 

After eleven things pick up - people start pouring in and usually a DJ will start livening things up with some tasty house music. 

I really like the vibe here -- it's easy to talk to people, the drinks are strong, and hell, any place in this town with a half-decent outdoor area gets good marks from me . .
author: Karsten P.

description:
We're REGULARS!

I have one of those faces the makes people think I hate them when really I'm just thinking about what color lip gloss I want to get out of my purse. So you can imagine it's pretty hard for me to find a place where I don't scare everyone.  

But at Mars, I belong. People are vaguely happy to see me. Sometimes, I'll get some M&Ms just for being there. And the Bartenders always remember I like my manhattans made with knob creek!
