author: Zinna R.

description:
I had heard of this place before as a 30-somethings joint, but when I went there tonite it seemed like a relatively young crowd.  mid-20s to mid-30s?  Anyway, I'm in that range now, so I liked that.  haha.  It was really colorful and cute, and pretty big, cuz there's a whole patio area in the back.  There's two rooms indoors, one having the bar area, the second having the DJ (the music was good too tonite!).  Plus there are plenty of tables and seats.  

I liked our bartender cuz he was hella friendly and had this like huge smile permanently glued to his face.  hehehe.  He was kinda cute actually.  Anyway, he was really friendly and totally remembered my friend from when then went b4.  He made me a nice mojito.

The funniest part of the night were these girls that were grinding all up on each other near the bar.  I was almost certain that these girls were lesbians.  My friends were trying to enlighten me though, telling me that girls like to do that so they get attention from guys.  Is this true??  Something like, a girl looking like she is practically doing another girl makes a guy think she's hella down and will go for her?  (This was the logic my friends posed to me).  I duno though, i was not convinced.  I mean, if you're sticking ur ass in another girl's crotch, u gotta be swingin that way, i would think.  Cuz I could never understand having the urge myself to do that.  Regardless of trying to impress a guy.  

Anyway, i suppose that discussion is not relevant to Mars Bar.  So i will save it for later, for those of u interested.
author: Labonee M.

description:
$1.50 Red Stripes during happy hour, Red Stripe themed girls passing out coupons, outdoor seating. 

Enough said. this place is a winner.
author: Carlos V.

description: I haven't been to this location in a long time.  Basically I just felt like it was another place to order a drink.  Nothing special.  Just didn't seem like a sweet spot for me.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
I just got home from Mars Bar, it took me 6 minutes to drive home! 

This is a great bar, inside it's roomy and spacious, a full bar with lots of bar stools and tables, pool table to dance on, DJ booth, outdoor patio with a bar and lots more tables. The bartenders were really busy and they were all so nice when I ordered my coke with a quiet smile. They gave me a big glass. Thank you to The Boss, the DJ, all the staff and Yelp. You guys are cool. 

I tried the chicken sausage (pretty yum) and the pulled pork mini burger (more yum), they also had some kind of mushroom with goat cheese thing that I didn't try because I couldn't see it and I'm scared of mushrooms.

As for the Yelp event at the Mars Bar...
http://yelp.com/biz/cwbiKgQLuJJMBXWozQ9KBg#hrid:JCZR1Rp7i54tmBegupLzww
author: Lorrie N.

description:
I like this place. It's small, cozy and the workers are really nice.
I love the outside heated patio area. Be advised, when thought heaters kick in...you won't be able to hear anything but the loud buzzing till they turn down:)
author: Joshua B.

description:
Good place to go to get drunk. Nice selection of beers on tap
The outdoor patio is the best. Heated lamps and light-up waterfall and all. 
Pool table. Turntables. 
The bartenders kind of suck.
author: joanna r.

description:
It had probably been 3-4 years since my last visit to Mars Bar, which was prompted by a visit to see a friend's band,  but another friend's birthday began with a drink there tonight.  I arrived to find that I was crashing a bachelorette, on their second of three strippers, complete with genitalia drink stirrers, and matching confetti.  'Nuf said.

The ladies at the bachelorette were more than friendly to our party of 8-offering extra cake, bringing the stripper over for a birthday girl dance, and insisting the birthday girl have some champagne.  

There is a ten dollar minimum on credit cards.  There is a nice outside patio, but I'm told the fire department confiscated the outdoor heaters, so dress warm if you intend to use it.  Easy parking, and aside from the bachelorette, was completely empty between 8:30-10:30 on a Saturday night, which can be refreshing if you're looking for that.
author: Beth V.

description:
I have never eaten here but I have been here several times for drinks.  I like it here.  It's never too packed but never super empty either. You can sit at the bar, or a table on the patio or play pool or sit at a table inside.  People here are not dressed down as it's not a dive, but they aren't all whored out either.  Good place to hang out with friends if you don't feel like getting dolled up but also are tired of the dive bar scene.   

 We ordered 3 shots, and the bartender because it took so long, ended up giving us the shots in a tall glass with a straw and not even charging us.  That makes me a fan.
author: Denise B.

description:
Good cheap food.  Really excellent daily specials too.  Like today, $2 tacos and $2 Tecate!  Filled me up quite nicely.

Also the waitresses here are always so polite and sweet.  I've yet to encounter any bad attitudes.  One of my latest favorite lunch break spots.
author: Mary R.

description:
I went here for a friends birthday party a couple of weeks ago. From the outside, the place looked completely dead because I practically got a parking spot right outside the front door. But once inside, I noticed that the place had a very neighborhood feel to it, with a lot of the patrons looking like they were regular customers. The decor was pretty sleek and laid back, with the bar in the first room, then a second room with a pool table/ TV/ tables and a door leading to a small outside drinking area.

Aside from the bday friends, the place seemed pretty quiet and tame for the night. The DJ showed up around 11, and it took him a minute to figure things out with the music. The bartenders were nice enough and the drinks were strong enough, but the only bummer was that they didn't accept credit cards.

I don't know if I'd go out of my way to go back, but I did have a good time while I was there.
author: kat a.

description: Was here for the Great Urban Race.  Finally had the food and loved the mars burger and pulled pork sandwich, both rocked!  I would also recommend the frieds with bacon and cheese.  Don't forget kids, bacon makes everything better!
author: Brian A.

description:
It's a good place. It's small, but very comfortable. I love Saturday nights there; some interesting people and house music that makes my body move non-stop.

They got some good Mojitos there by the way. Make sure you get them at the indoor bar and not from the outside patio bar. I really enjoy that they have an outdoor area with tables and candles. Really really cute and refreshing especially when you dance as much as I do usually.

Try it out. It's not a club, but one of the best places I've been in SF for music and drinks.
author: Katja S.

description:
Mars rocks for lunch, afternoon, or happy hour.  Here's why:
1) The food!  Surprising good, not to mention affordable.  On Wednesday, it's all about the fried chicken special.  Trust me.  It's worth a special trip.  Otherwise, I recommend the pizzas (best $6.75 pizza in the city) or whatever the special of the day is.
2) Fantastic patio.  I've spent many an afternoon lingering here after a great lunch and a beer on a nice sunny day.
3) Lively, but not too crowded
4) Friendly service from the nice waitress staff
5) Solid bartenders

8/29/2007 Update - 5 stars!
Mars keeps getting better and better.  Today they made me something for lunch that wasn't even on the menu (it was combination of 2 specials) and it was awesome!
author: Josh L.

description:
I'm pretty sure this place is watering down their liquor.

I usually wouldn't call out a bar like this, but after trying three different types of tequilla (Herraduras, Don Julio, Patron) I'm fairly certain they had changed the formula. I think they added some kind of liqueor to it cause it had a sweet taste.

So keep them honest; order beer.
author: Tan H.

description:
We went here for a photo wrap party the other week. I didn't drink (I was pumped full of painkillers thanks to a terrible headache) but as a result I was probably the only one who got an accurate taste for the food.

The food is definitely bar food - out of everything I tried, the mozzarella sticks were definitely the best. The cheese pizza wasn't that bad, though I must admit the crust was slightly strange - a little too "frozen pizza from the supermarket" for me. The chips and salsa could have used a little more salsa and a little less chips but both were good, particularly the pico di gallo. I didn't get to the quesadillas in time, but I did hear quite a few approvals on them.

I liked the atmosphere of the outdoor patio, but over by the pool table, where we were sitting, was a little lacking. The entrance was more attractive than our area, also, but we were a big party and we were sort of glad to sit anywhere, rather than be picky about the scenery.

The waitress was pretty sweet, and incredibly patient with the 20+ of us, so thumbs up on the service.
author: Maddy S.

description: Great place to order a drink and appetizers and sit out on the back patio with friends or coworkers and relax. They have umbrellas if it's too sunny.
author: Marie F.

description:
We stopped here to have a little din-din before heading off to see Stephen Lynch at the Warfield.  Not an important in regards to the review, just felt like bragging about who we saw...

From the outside, it looks like a little hole in the wall.  Inside: okay, nothing to write home about, but I noticed the outside patio was packed so that may have been the place to sit.  It was around 6:30p, lots of thirty-somethings hanging out after work for Happy Hour and a few people at the bar.  Whatever, seemed cool.  

There's something to be said about burgers being served on toasted brioche.  I'll go ahead and say it:  CRIKEY, it was damn good.

We were also able to sample the wasabi aioli and chipotle aioli for our fries.  Delish.  All in all, we left as happy campers with full tummies; we had enough fuel to go laugh our asses off.
author: sheridan r.

description: It's a dive bar with Lounge prices. I would only go back if I really needed a drink and was in the area. The patio was nice, but doesn't make up for the overall vibe.
author: Corvette M.

description:
Mars is a decent place to get your groove, mack, and your swerve on.

I'll come when they have decent DJ' s spinning house music.  The patio is cool when the weather is nice.  Bartenders are usually on point with a good attitude.  

My only complaint is the pool table in the middle of the dancefloor.  What's that about?
author: Shelly S.

description: I came here after work on my birthday...it was a little after 6 when we arrived....it was pretty crackin inside.  We grabbed a seat outside and as more and more of my coworkers joined us, all I remember is having a great time and getting quite tipsy :)  Hey, it was my birthday, I'm allowed!  I vaguely remember every one who worked there to be super nice...this was my 3rd time here, so I may have been drawing from my other experiences there, all of which were good.
author: Ashley J.

description:
I came here the other night with a friend. We were tired of chain restaurants to get drinks in the peninsula so we decided to go into the city on a Thursday evening for happy hour. 

This place is really chill. It was pretty packed due to the game being on. Music was on point. Old school hip hop how can you go wrong...i could have sat there all night bobbing my head to the music with a beer in hand. The food was delicious too. We had the bacon cheese fries and burger. YUM! it's a cute little place if you're looking for a chill time or play pool. I will definitely be venturing back here again.
author: Jazmine S.

description:
Two beautiful words...Outdoor Seating

The outdoor seating here is great, it's like a little beer garden in this city of limited quality outdoor seating. And the booths inside are perfect for good times with groups.

Haven't tried the food but I hear it's good - I'll update after I've eaten here.

The only downside is that they charged $5 cover for the "DJ"....A $5 cover charge is like saying my girlfriend is "sorta" pregnant.  If you're gonna ask for a cover make sure the entertainment is good. Asking for $5 is like saying we're not too sure our entertainment is all that good and were somewhat ashamed of asking for money...go big or give it for free.  I felt like the girl at the door was pimping for her boyfriend who was in fact the DJ.
author: Doug C.

description:
This review is for the restaurant, particularly lunch time. 

I really enjoy Mars Restaurant. It's laid back, the decor is cute and the food is pretty spot-on. Since I've been interning at the public defenders office I usually need a spot to go to for lunch, other then McDonald's or Cafe Roma. The Burger, Quesadilla , and BBQ pulled Pork Sandwich are all winners in my book. Mars is easy, quick, and always what you expect not to mention delish.
author: Sarah T.

description: Reliably nice, affordable place for casual lunch, especially on the patio. Relaxed, not too crowded. Great service. Grilled tuna salad is perfect on the light side, good burgers and sandwiches too.
author: Amelia B.

description:
I do love the dizzying span of restaurant choices in SF, but sometimes I wish I could be like those people (mostly on TV) who seem to always be hanging out at the same spot, because it's THEIR place.  Like the Friends at Central Perk.  Oh wait, did I just date myself?  I mean, like the How I Met Your Mother crowd at MacLaren's.

Well, at least I have no choice for after-work drinks: it's Mars all the way, simply because it's the only place everyone is willing to walk to.  So I have a feeling that every official going-away party, launch party, etc, is going to be right here.  Fortunately, it's a good spot for it.  Fire up a game of pool, enjoy the appetizers and beer (on the company's tab, of course) and get that classic "what a long week, it's 5:00 on Friday so let's start drinking, this night is going to be so epic" rush that's a sure sign you'll be asleep in 3 hours.  I just gotta think ahead and bring a jacket next time, cuz the breeze from the outdoor patio is damn cold.
author: Wes M.

description:
Went there last night for a friend's bday. 

Things I remember:
-Strong smell of marijuana from the back patio
-Diverse crowd made up of some dancers who had zero rhythm -- made for some good people watching
-Some really wasted people sucking face while attempting to dance
-Decent hip hop music

Would only go back if another "special occasion" was happening there.
author: Wen T.

description:
Love it or hate it, Mars is a staple in my life. This place has been the destination of countless farewells, congratulatory drinks, and weekend starters over the last 6 years.

Hooray to them for having Boont on tap. I have no complaints to the staff, and the bartenders are always attentive. The drinks are never watery, the music goes from tolerable to quite good,  and the bar food is fairly dependable and good. 

Food: Calamari, buffalo wings and quesadillas everyone seems to like. Their burgers are not bad either.The turkey club has real cuts of turkey breast, if you don't mind the really dry roll it comes on. I guess that's what the lemon aioli is for (it also has some thyme-y pesto on the bottom bun). 

Drinks: good solid cocktails, well-primed kegs and efficient staff. 

Ambience: the indoor seating can get a bit too loud. I prefer the outdoor patio if the heaters are on and for you smokers, they do allow smoking on the patio area. pool table in the back room is rarely free and can be difficult to use when it gets busier. 

In the voice of my old buddy JFB, M-A-R-S: Mars, bitches.
author: Mortiche W.

description:
Once upon a time I thought it wasn't hip enough of  a joint, but I have to appreciate its down-to-earth servers and relaxed but quirky atmosphere. 

Heaven forbid, not only could we find a place to sit, we were able to get consistent attention...flowing beverages and food for the whole evening. This pos vibe transitioned into a few rounds of pool and catching up with co-workers and friends with neighborhood music in the background. Cool artwork as well. The variety of booths, bar side, back room and outdoor lounge seating are fabulous. CLEAN bathrooms.

If only they could downplay the liquor promo teams. Minus one start for the Beefeater folks and their weak recipes (very poor sample drinks BTW)...And when we didn't buy drinks with Beefeater product, the young woman with the Brit Flag jacket suit promo outfit swiped up our coupons -- WHILE we were eating -- not even making eye contact.

Best of all, as long as they are serving food, we're allowed to bring the Bug in...about time the kid learns to shoot some pool...
author: Tanya P.

description: Cheap drinks, low key especially on Sundays. Ended the night here with friends; chilled in the back patio under a few heat lamps. No cover charge. We came on a hiphop night. Def coming back.
author: Mika D.

description:
I've been to Mars Bar twice.  Once was for a Halloween party where a bunch of house DJs were spinning.  Unfortunately, the main dance floor isn't level.  This is somewhat disorienting and it makes it easy to go careening into the window wall.  The second time was this past Friday for a friend's birthday party.   I had a good time, but it was the company, not so much the venue.

Also, I hope the really really super sloppy drunk chick on Friday night, who was slurring about how much it sucked to go out alone and hanging all over every guy in the place, made it home okay.  *pats head*  Aww... so tragic.
author: Apollo L.

description: The owners of this place are awesome and it shows with the "Cheers" type atmosphere. All the bartenders are really friendly and the drinks are stiff.  I love the patio here, which has heat lamps and a generous amount of tables and chairs. The food for lunch is pretty good too, especially the burger and steak salad are both delish. Great spot for a chill afternoon or night out.  And Sundays on the patio are SF at its best!  Oh, and there is a wicked dancefloor too with DJ's pumping out great tracks most every night!
author: Brittany T.

description:
I had the pleasure of DJing there. Christopher, Ananalee and the other lovely bartneder whose name I forgot (doh) were realyl awesome and charming.

The place's layout is superb, and defintiely conducive to large parties, with the outdoor patio being awesome for a daytime party.

The crowd was varied, the night was amazing, I couldn't be happier. I've found my new hangout spot.
author: Sergio ..

description: So these guys give nothing but GREAT service, strong drinks and the only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars is because the food is....well just bar food.  Otherwise great place, and especially because of the staff.
author: Carlos S.

description: I worked around the corner for about 6 years and this was a go to place for happy hour and celebrations.  A fun place with a nice wacky atmosphere.  The patio is a great place to hang and the staff were always cool.  Ok bar food.
author: Patrick S.

description: Lively SOMA bar with a decent lunch menu.  I went there recently after work to celebrate a co-worker's departure.  It was bustling with people and the bartenders were friendly.  It also wasn't too crowded, which was nice since you could actualy move around.
author: Aaron W.

description:
Probably not the best place for me to review... I don't drink much and there's only one or two things on the menu I can order. But it is a good place to go to for work lunches (patio), and today the service was really (suprisingly) quick.  I pretty much order the same thing every time (Ahi tuna salad), and although today it was really good - not too much vinagarette, not stingy on the tuna, and it was actually rare as I like it - the portion was way smaller than usual.  But it was good. I'd recommend it for sure.

I like how they now have sun umbrellas for all the patio tables (I've been stuck in the sun and burnt several times in the past). 

If they add a couple other non-fried options to the menu, another star from me!  I'd give it a 3.5, but I'm upping it to a 4. Sun was out today and good company and quick service made for a nice lunch.
author: Jen D.

description:
OK, our visit here was probably my first independent visit as a result of visiting somewhere for a Yelp event.

We had to think of a place to meet my bf's friends from out of town, and this was the middle ground where I thought it was good to meet. Parking's not bad and we got there a bit early, so it wasn't crowded yet. The gin & tonics I had were decent.

The only major bummer was that the heater outside was broken and we were freezing to death! Fix that shit! ;)
author: Emily M.

description:
My friend got the first round: $13. I got the second: $38.  

I asked how much the Don Julio 1942 was, and the bartender just dismissed me with "oh, $25 or something..." So much for that.


The beefeater was standing outside when we arrived, and there were Beefeater signs on all of the tables with drink recipes on them. When we tried to order them, the bartender claimed complete ignorance about these drinks.

It was pretty crowded when we got there on a Friday night, but we managed to drive them all away by our second round and we were pretty much alone in the front room by around 10:30ish.

But I still like the place and I plan on adding it to my happy hours rounds. Props to the bartender for making drinks girly enough for the guys I was with. It was some sweet concoction of vanilla vodka and juice. Oh, and I liked that my martini came in a stemless glass, which is must less spill-prone compared to normal martini glasses.
author: Lauren H.

description:
Recently came here for my 10 year high school reunion (go AHS Hornets!) and had a really great time. There are plenty of tables and chairs, a nice long bar, an open space in the back for pool and/or dancing, and an outdoor patio with another bar and lots of seating. The bartenders were cool and the vibe was very positive and upbeat. The drinks are average price and it is easy to find parking nearby. 

I've also had lunch here during the work week. A popular spot for judges, attorneys and cops because it is a block away from the Hall of Justice. Good club sandwiches.
author: Jenny K.

description:
Mars is my favorite after work bar in town. You can find a million different walks of life in one place gettin down.
You've got :
Public Defenders from the Hall of Justice
Judges
Artists
Musicians/Producers(myself and a few) others
DJs
Cops
Dolby Folks
Suits of other varieties
and just plain ol dirtbags too
The food is actually decent for bar food and there's a few selections that are out of the ordinary for a bar scene....like the ahi tuna for example.
If you wanna find me after 5....I'll be there
author: michael s.

description: Love it here. Clean, open, airy, warm and friendly staff (Paul and Jovi rock!), great food and salads, good selection of cold beer, convenient to work. Could become my second office - what's NOT to love?!?
author: C B.

description:
so I was there on two different nights, doing drink promos.  What does that mean you ask?  Drink companies pay for girls like me to go to clubs and inform patrons about drink specials, usually a drink special involving the booze they are trying to promote.

sometimes the drink special involves berry flavors or another drink with high sweet favor, what does that mean for doing promo at mar's you ask? There's a lot of laid back beer drinkers so that inevitably means talking with the women and flirting with them(compliments attention etc) to get them to buy drinks.

Surprisingly Mar's is not a bad place for this type of promo, which makes me think underneath all girl need a little socializing from another supposedly hot female, or perhaps it says something about mars' popularity among bisexual females, or maybe it's just SF in general, I really don't know enough to say for sure.

A guy let me take a few sip of his mojitos. Being an afaciando of latin drinks I give thumb's up for the mojitos at mar's.  The bartenders do make solid drinks, although it's funny cuz sometimes we have really funky drink specials and we have to hold the signs to make sure bartenders know what we are asking them to make.

people who gather at bars tend to be more social about talking to strangers, while people in the back patio(very nice by the way!) keep to themselves.  Food is very good there, surprisingly esp since I don't expect good food in bars at all.

beautiful lemon drops as well.  I bartend private parties so I pay attention to drinks when I go out. They serve it in a martini glass with a solid bottom that's round, which probably makes it harder to knock over.  Do NOT try to order a martini or anything that needs to be shaked on the backup bar, I beg you.  The more complicated stuff it's always a good idea to ask at the main bar.

Mojitos are pretty and the crowd at Mar's are to, in my experience the patrons tend to congregate around the 30's crowd.  The happy hours are very happening given the time of day.  easy parking, what can I say?  Part of living in SF taught me the joy of appreciating seemingly mundane things like finding parking spot, something my SJ friends fail to grasp.

we end up giving the red feather boa we used for the promo to an older gentleman, who wore it with pride.  welcome to SF, it's not mar's but you won't know when you are in Mar's bar.
author: Jamie L.

description:
I'm a philanthropist.  I willingly give my time to a good cause - like boosting a bar's revenue.  But yesterday I was actually meeting with a volunteer marketing committee to drink lots of wine, no I mean to plan a fund raising dinner for HRC, whatever. 

 Well I was stuck downtown with an hour to kill. I walked from the Mall (YUCK) to the concourse exhibition center.  I thought about going into Annie's for a beer, I thought about going into Folsom Gulch for some slurp and jerk, but I decided to just keep going.  Then I saw Catalyst and no that wasn't right either.   

Finally I saw Mars.  It looked clean.  It had windows.  There was a decent crowd inside for 6:30pm and I went for it.  After sitting at the bar I noticed there is another room with tables and beyond that a sunny, crowded patio.  It was pretty chill and comfortable.  The bartenders were all cute, the boys and the girls, and friendly.  A Newcastle it is!

Then the guys next to me start talking to some guy Keith who looks crazy familiar.  I know I know him from somewhere.  Well he was busy with work stuff and I had a beer so I just started texting ravers from my past.  No one could come up with the Keith that I think I know but we remembered tons of crazy Keiths.  Then some freestyle beats come on followed up by quite a few good house tracks.  Then it hits me.  I used to see this dude at parties back in the day.  Don't know if I ever actually knew him.  

Moral of the story is - I really liked sitting across from the venue that I spent many crazy nights in the mid 90s in dropping pills, smoking weed and dancing to some of the best house music ever (do you remember The Gathering, Organic and the others?) - in a chill bar with cool peeps around passing time til my next philanthropic endeavor.
author: Ian M.

description:
there's definitely life on mars, or at mars.

mars is the 1st stop kinda place. at 10:45 this place was beat droppin' panty stoppin' (what is panty stoppin'??).

when i left around 1:45, i asked the door man if this was a normal, crowded, or slim night. he peeped his counter and said they were at 308 for the night. he said when there's a promoter and multiple dj's his count hits 600's. i can believe it, cause by 12:30 everyone had left in order to be at their second destination.

start the night off right, start it at mars.
author: Ameer N.

description:
Just went there for lunch-the chicken-apple-brie sandwich is fantastic. 
Plus the fries are skinny and crispy like I like em. Wished I couldve washed it down with one of their many good beers on tap-but alas I was there with my bosses. 
However, they seemed to be "out" of a lot of stuff. No more fish&chips or steak at 1230pm on weekday? Not good.
author: Lauren T.

description: I came here for lunch the other day and was pleasantly surprised.  It actually felt like a restaurant, and the menu was much larger than I expected.  I got a house salad.  It was quite enjoyable.
author: Tony S.

description: One of my favorite places to stop in, whether for a couple cocktails after work or for Bloody Mary's and lunch on a nice day. The inside bar atmosphere is everything you would want in a chill bar with out being a dive or dirty, the outside patio is great on a nice day or relaxing at night with heaters that over hang and cover the entire patio instead of just small sections, so no need to huddle together to stay warm in the lovely SF weather. They also add a second patio in the summer where the side parking lot is by encasing the drive way off with planter boxes, it makes for more space and more sun when everyone wants to be outside. The staff is lively, entertaining and personable, Amber by for is one of the funniest bartenders I have met, but everyone of the crew is just as great. The food is awesome for bar food, they change their menu for time to time and also add daily specials, vegetarian options are decent and your not afraid to dive in when sitting at the bar. If your in the neighborhood I would definitely stop in and hang out for an hour or so, you might just make some new friends, once you've been there once you're going to come back.
author: Mandi S.

description:
Lunches are tasty here. 

Great little night spot when some good DJ's are throwin' down and the patio is open.
author: Matt H.

description:
Get there early for their new dim-sum menu.  The potstickers melt in your oversized mouth.  Also, on wednesdays they have "Bayou Night" and servr some authentic cajun gumbo and crawfish pie. Yee Haw!!!!!!

Ok, so I made all that shit up.  Too many dirty martinis.  I went here on a Friday at around 9ish to 10ish and it was ok.  It so has potential.  I can see some serious parties here on the right night., esp. with the outside patio being like right there.  I will probably on go here again if there was some special occasion or something.  A b-day party would be nice here if you didn't want to go all out and reserve some VIP booths at a hot club.  Bleh,  I got a belly full of Sparky's and nothing else to say about Mars Bar.
author: Jeremy P.

description:
Mars was pretty much empty last Friday night, save for my crew (and the random stretch limo that pulled up and filled the place with a dozen drunken Latinos).  I felt this was a good opportunity to really study the place, instead of spending my time fighting to get a drink at the bar and weaving through an inebriated crowd.

The decor is simple and somewhat industrial.  The place is relatively small with a cozy vibe.  It could easily be a "neighborhood bar" if it weren't attempting to go for the whole trendy nightlife scene.  The outdoor patio area is a nice touch.  The bartender, Christopher, makes a mean mojito, and certainly wins my personal Dave Grohl impersonation contest that everyone unwittingly enters.

Overall, good drinks, good music, good times.  The place was dead last Friday night, but I'm all about having the whole bar to myself, so mark that as a big plus in my book.  I'll definitely be back, all things considered.
author: Rajiv B.

description:
Full Bar with food for lunch. Pretty good food too.
Did I mention they have an outdoor patio with seating where you can smoke?
OMG, I think I'm in heaven!
author: Rory V.

description:
I am undecided about this place.  While it is convenient, it isn't always what I am looking for.  It can be a bit grungy for me.

The bartenders are really nice, I've only ordered beers here but it's a full service bar.  

Pool table in the back and a dj.  

If you are looking for a convenient spot to get a drink with a friend, this will work for you.
author: Inga B.

description:
My coworkers and I had an outing at Mars Bar 2 months ago, and it was quite a night.  The food that we had was pretty good, I think, although they were just appetizers.

The only few things I remember was that the overall atmosphere in this place was really lively, the pool table is awesome, and I drank a lot, haha.  Hopefully, we'll hit this spot again for another one of our outings.
author: Marlon E.

description:
Burger was great. Corona topped things off just right.

Owner is very friendly.
author: Art A.

description:
As promised to my boyfriend, I'm reluctantly writing this review, not because I liked the place but because I've been lazy lately in writing any reviews. So here goes, the music SUCKS!! The bartenders make lousy drinks, don't ever ask for a margarita, because all you'll get is mostly margarita mix. Oh, and when ordering anything from the bar, make sure a girl orders, otherwise the bartender will charge you more for drinks like he did to my boyfriend! WTF! The food is very mediocre. Did I mention the music?? Yeah, I did but just so you get the message, unless you like crap DJs, who play crap music, then this is the place to go, but seriously, the music SUCKS and is waaaay too loud! 
I can't imagine anyone ever suggesting this place!
author: Lola D.

description: This place is solid. Lots of character, love the outdoor patio, nice pool table, beer selection, good specials and the food is really pretty good - especially the pulled pork sandwich. The icing on the cake is the very hot, and very friendly waitresses.
author: M L.

description: We were looking for a little weekday lunch after walking around the GiftCenter and saw the Mars Bar.  I Yelped it and saw the solid positive reviews, so we decided to give it a try.  It's not much to look at on the outside, but once inside, we saw a nice, clean bar and table area.  People were pleasant, a nice mix of moms, dudes, techies and us!  Good selection of beers and bourbons, well stocked bar.  I like a place that has pear cider on tap!  We ordered roast beef sandwich, portobello burger, fries and the new england clam chowder.  Everything was tasty, clam chowder was excellent with lots of fresh clams and carefully chopped bits of potatoes, ham, and carrots, could've had a quart of that with some sourdough and been happy for days.  Servers were friendly, and the atmosphere was very comfortable, even for first timers like us.  We also enjoyed that they had the old movie channel playing on the tvs, it's a neat conversation starter, nice scenes to look at, like have moving art on the walls.  We will definitely be back, and add it to our GiftCenter visits!
author: C. C.

description:
Mars bar was my Dot.Com hangout for quite a while.
We took our 2 hour long lunches there, eating food and drinkin beer.
The patio is great most times of the year, and the food is always great.
author: Tom S.

description:
Juanita MORE's funky fried chicken brunch and her equally funky fried chicken oscar party continue to draw me to this SOMA establishment.

The chicken (with the honey goo!) is out of this world, but what I like best about Mars Bar is that there are strings of beads hanging from the doorway to the bathroom.  I could run back and forth through that curtain of beads all night!
author: Marcus C.

description:
1 star for the fab burger.
1 star for the great waitress.
1 star for the $2 red stripe beers during happy hour.
-1 star for not being able to hear myself think.
-1 star for the buffalo wings.
author: Adela K.

description:
I really dig this place. Funky - clean - friendly - and in the middle of nowhere, really.

You wouldn't know it to look at this place, but their food is descent, the drinks are big, the service is awesome, and it's a very ecclectic place to hang out with anyone in your motley crew. Hipsters in one room, white collars in another room, dancing bartenders, sexy djs, pool table, outdoor heated patio, big bar AND lots of  tables if you prefer...what's not to love? 

It really doubles as more of a sports bar, although no one in the SOMA seems to know that.

Shhhh, don't tell anyone.
In fact, forget you read this at all.
author: E.Mo. ..

description:
Maybe I'm a little partial to this spot because it's where my boyfriend and I spent most of our evenings out when we first started dating. I love the Mars Bar, though.

It's sort of a divey place, but with better food than I expected to find. 
They serve a good selection of good bar food and salad. It's a good place to  grab a bite during happy hour, then go sit at a booth in the back where all the lighting is red and have some drinks and talk with your friends. The DJ was always pretty good, too. And it's clean.
author: Heidi G.

description:
Cute fun little dive bar.  I used to work close by and it was a favorite hang out.  Nice outdoor space.  I never tried the food, but they usually had a some wine around, key for me as I don't do beer.
I thought I' through in my two cents.  If you haven't been, give it a try.
author: Kara H.

description:
I've been going to Mars for about 9 years now, mostly because it's a block away from my work. 

Patio: a great patio in the back. So few bars in San Francisco have any outdoor area, but this one is the best I've seen

Great Service: the staff is friendly and efficient.  The place can get a bit crowded, especially during Friday happy hour, but they alway seem to be able to handle the crowd.

They have a pool table, but they move it for parties too much, so don't expect it to be very true(minus one star)

Good bar food, and good happy hour specials.
author: Mike T.

description: Guess this is the place to be for a birthday bash. Went here for my friends 30th on a friday. there is lots of room for a celebration, comfy seating, pool table, music and a sweet outdoor area. I would give this place a strong 4 star but the few drinks I had were  a bit watery, even when you request top shelf. I dont think I would go to this spot on my own accord but never say never.
author: Tamrin H.

description:
I have been going to Mars since 1994, and let me tell you, there have been many a drunk night here.  This place has always been fun to go to.  Whether your outside on the patio or inside playing pool.  It is a cool spot to meet friends, grab some drinks, and hang out.  The atmosphere is cool, and bar staff friendly.  
I don't go out a lot anymore, but I have always liked this place a lot.
Oh beware of the bathroom stalls, it's a bit on the western side.
author: Stephanie H.

description: I agree with JX C, and Josie M.  Mars Bar is friendly, inexpensive, the DJ's especially for the Summer Sundays events are amazing.  They often have legendary DJs like Julius Papp, Miguel Migs, David Harness and others who perform at these events probably mostly for the incredibly friendly and down to earth patrons and staff.  If you've never been here before you'll immediately feel right at home.  No phony, showy stuff goes on here and the food is the same.  Burgers and fries I've had were large in size and absolutely delicious.  This is a comfortable, homey place.  Love it!  Jenny, the manager is wonderful, too.
author: Jan D.

description:
I had never been into this establishment before. I had driven by it at least 1000 times but I never felt like actually going into the seemingly non descript bar on the corner of 7th and Brannan. I had heard of people talk about this place a couple of years ago before I lived in SOMA. 


Well if you live in the city and you ave experienced the last few days of unseasonably warm and fantastic weather well then you probably like I have been in a desperate attempt to find killer outdoor patios that let the sun in but shield the wind. Mars' outdoor patio performs. As I was sitting outside I noticed that there is also a VERY LARGE heater above you so that it probably performs as a fantastic patio eve in the evening. The bar is a bar and all bars are the same, booze and beer, the bar food is above average for bar fare here in the city. I would put it on par with other fantastic bar grub that I have been tasting lately, reviews to follow. All this would usually lead to 4 stars. I reserve 5 stars for joints that really outperform the competition or if I have A LOT of fun at a place. I had a lot of fun yesterday... 


Newcastle was doing a promotion there and Newcastle was 3 bucks a pint which is a good deal, and they were giving away glasses, not the kind you wear but the kind that you drink beer from. That is awesome. I love free shit. I ordered Newcastle and the wife ordered Newcastle and we chatted and were having a real good time. But that wasn't what made it fun, something else made it a lot more fun than it should have been. 


I've lived here for a while and and there is always some beer or booze company doing something somewhere, like when the Camel Cigarette girls would walk around and give away free cigarettes. Man I wish they still did that. Well you know how these girls are they are semi good looking dressed a little bit more proactively than they would usually dress they walk around give away free shit smile and I guess that is their job... Pretty good gig if you can get it I guess. 
They gave us free glasses and they also gave us $1 coupons for future purchases of Newcastle. Score. So we were drinking our Newcastles and we were done and we were waiting for our check and the Newcastle Girl comes back and says "OK we'll be taking your $1 coupons now the promotion is over" 


Unbeknownst to her I had read the "coupon" and it wasn't a coupon at all. Instead it was a $1 dollar check to "ANY RETAILER THAT SELLS NEWCASTLE" redeemable until 12/3/2010. Knowing this I knew tat this check was invaluable so I wanted to keep it. I like Newcastle, and if I can get $1 off well then that's nothing short of fantastic. She briefly tried to argue with me until she found that I am an obstinate son of a bitch and she wasn't taking my coupon back. 


And that is why my experience at Mars was so good. I deal with idiots all day everyday at wok and I'm sure that many of you reading this do as well. Many times you are not in a position in a place of business to actually point out someones idiocracy to their face, although that would would make everyday at work 5 stars for me, it is not beneficial usually to your continued employment. But this woman who I would assume has gotten by on her limited attractiveness her whole life, found herself defeated by a relatively fat and unattractive dude that was just a little bit smarter than her. was thinking that maybe she gets paid for every coupon she gives out and then gets double paid if she gets them back... I don't know... However I will say that it was one of the best human exchanges I have had in a while. 


I had a teacher that one time told me that studying and doing well on an exam is one of life's simple pleasures. I didn't do that well in school and wasn't interested in what they were selling, however I will say that pointing out idiocracy to a person who is in fact a bona-fide idiot is one of life's simple pleasures and one that I enjoy, maybe a little too much.
author: Anthony Y.

description: HH! Impressive by the powerfully heat outside seating gave this place 3 stars... But the wings are ok... Pizza is ok... Pool was ok... Service is pretty nice and fast actually. Next time I will sit inside and actually feel the music... cause for now, I have no idea!
author: Flora F.

description: Went here the other night with a few friends and it was OK. I was baffled by how sparse the place was but they tried to cover that up by playing the tv sets super loud with the jukebox competing, not cool. Also went in on a night there was a reserved party taking up the other end of the outside / dance floor. The staff were great and so were the drinks, just wasn't into the environment.
author: Wilfred C.

description: My oldest son found this little place on the internet. I had been doing a project close by and had walked past it numerous times before he joined me there for lunch one fine day. Don't let it's rough exterior fool you. This is truly a gem in the rough. I've had most of the items on their menu and have yet to try something I didn't thoroughly enjoy. My favorite by far was the Ahi Steak Sandwich. Pan seared rare and thicker than you would expect. If your down town some day catching a Giants game or just enjoying the day make it a point to check this little secret out.
author: Michael F.

description: My friend recommended this place for their burgers. We arrived at 12:30... sat in the patio. At 12:45 I tried to hunt down someone to serve us. The management claimed they were getting a late start. The opening bar tender did not show and the kitchen, which opens at noon was running late. We waited and waited; still no attention. I went to the bar and ordered a beer from their limited selection, carried it to my own table. Still no service. Someone dropped off one menu for the two of us, no burgers and a ,very poor selection  and again we waited. I asked the kitchen if they were open, and they said yes. Told the "server" we were ready, she ignored me. Everyone seemed too busy setting up for the game, while some too loud music boomed from the other room. The most attention I received was from some hooker, who tried to pick me up. If you are a drunk or a low life; this is the place for you. If you want great food and better service, eat at The Pork Store across from the Roxie on 16th street. This place sucks!!
author: Jan N.

description: Randomly decided to kick off our drinking day at the Mars Bar, never been before and it was in the middle of no where in SOMA. Went in bar area was empty, place is medium size with a cute patio. Randomly bumped into 2 friends and also just stumbled upon a JELLO Wrestling contest! YES!! Men and woman half naked in Jello, crazy but guy was kinda hot ha. Ok downed 2 drinks off to next bar...
author: Karen T.

description: If you're looking for a trendy bar with lots of signature drinks and snobby staff look elsewhere. If you want a great bar with cheap drinks, good food, good music, and a great crew that aren't afraid to cut loyal customers a deal then this is the spot for you. I've become a regular over the last couple of months because it happens to be situated directly on the way home from work...well that's what brought me in originally but everything above is why I always go back.
author: Andrus H.

description:
visited twice in a week. first time was after a marathon drinking session that started out at gc for kias birthday lunchbox stripperpalooza. 

so after drinking for about 9 hours, i ened up at mars. 

i got lost coming out of the bathroom. i couldnt find my way to the "real outside"........................

ok time to go home and sleep it off.

next was for the elite event the following wed. a couple of us got there before the elite choas ensued. the staff was in the middle of closing up the prior party, but they still were gracious with us early birds and got us some beers and stuff......

the bartenders are cool, funny and useful, "the boss" is awesome. theres three bars. 3!!!!!!!!!! an awesome outside smoking loungy area. i love this place.
author: Euge L.

description:
upside, great outdoor patio!  downside, avoid it when there is a baseball game. 

good crowd, but as the drinks keep flowing, folks seem to get a little wobbly, and the friendly, "excuse me" saying disappears. 

great place to have a quick drink, as you embark to another location.
author: Mauri L.

description:
i always feel like my favorte bars in SF close without notice or change into something lame. 

NOT Mars Bar- thank god! They did close and did change but when they reopened they became better IMO and thankfully didn't have the audacity to change their name. 

i LOVE their patio, it has plenty of tables, some funky tropical themeish thing going on and they have a practically fully stocked bar out there so you don't have to keep goign inside for a drink nor leave your drink inside like some lame places insist. 

they make strong drinks, seem to always have a whiskey sponsored party going on which ensures a fun and blurry evening. also they have a fabulous brunch on the weekends. 

on of my fav things is that they several seperated areas that all have a diff feel. the front main bar area is dimly lit with sleek tables and a loungey vibe, the second room which is on your way to the patio is dark and most of the time supplies the dance floor and DJ setup, the music is always loud in there to properly get your groove on. the patio, as I said, is an A+.... supplies a place to get a breather, have some conversation, have a smoke or order a drink quicker than on the inside. 

went here on my bday 2 years ago and knocked over one of the umbrellas over a table onto to a very large lady, about 4 times my size, as she stood up and got in my face i yelled ... "its okay its my birthday!"....luckily she didn't pulverize me! she did roll her eyes and call me a dumb slut..can't blame her though, i was rude and damn wasted.

i give it a full five stars for being close to my house and b/c its easy to grab a taxi when you do want/need to leave.
author: Adrienne P.

description: Cool space.. good place to hang out if you are in SOMA. I really like the back patio (nicely heated too!) and the diverse crowd.
author: Sarah W.

description:
Mars Bar is definitely a cool place to hang out , but the place needs some new bartenders! AnnaLee and Christopher, I believe their names were, were completely in their own world. The two obviously were "together" and publicly displayed their affection for each other by making out and groping each other behind the bar and ignoring their customers. I mean, really, get home and do that- you're at work, so WORK! Not to mention, they looked (or were) totally coked out. Totally unprofessional. 

After leaving the inside bar and going outside to the patio, things definitely were better. My friends and I ordered great food and got some great drinks from the brown-haired girl serving at the patio. She treated us much better than the couple inside. The bar plays some good music, too! I definitely recommend the place- but avoid AnnaLee & Christopher at all costs.
author: Linda I.

description: Near work, decent service, outdoor seating, rocking portabello mushroom burger.  What more do you need?
author: Max A.

description: Fantastic crowd (mostly from this community), sufficient space to move around, and an awesome heating system let you stand under the stars and keep toasty warm.
author: Wesley W.

description: I went there for their 3rd year anniversary, and I loved the way the bar is set up - bar area, then a pseudo dance area (I think it's just lounging when they don't have a DJ), an outdoor area with another bar, and a side outdoor/smoking area.  The bartenders were polite and attentive, and they weren't shy with sharing their alcohol.  The crowd that night was pretty ecclectic - but when I got there after midnight, only 5 people were dancing.  It picked up (the booty shaking), then it got all meat market-y.  Not Mars' fault.... it was "who am I going home with" o'clock.  I'll go again for sure
author: Lea R.

description: Felt like home! I've been here a few times and I thought it would be a good place to chill with friends and watch the giants game. I'm not a big sports bar fan, this place was perfect, attentive staff, good bar food, two nice tv's displaying the game, and a good hiphop dj.
author: Ryan M.

description: corner bar servin' up meals, brews 'n' spirits...friendly happy dappy spirits....bartenders givin' off good vibes...doing due diligence...producin' mass drinks in good spirits....samplin' of food a treat...good grubbin' treats at that....also handsome to add....tasting awesome....the norm off the standard menu lookin' good...droolin' over a burger being consumed by another.....always be a next time for that burger.....$four point two five for a corona...give a $five and only give seventy five cents? or give $six and give a dollar seventy five?.....definite pet peeve of mine...having change added to drink costs....make $four even....but, $three better for regular visits...six block walk from mi casa....
author: Hen A.

description: Oh my, it's better to drink here.  The outside is great, but the pizza was one of the worst I've ever had.  I'd had better microwave oven pizza's, unfortunately.
author: Mitch A.

description: I am so in awe of Jean Wang, Nish Nadaraja, and their respective yelp reviews (no false gods there), that I decided to indulge in the sincerest form of flattery.  I've been Mars-ing since each was underage.  Always an appealing spot, the place was recently bought by, literally, a hottie -- it says so on her business card.  She's married though so don't even think. . . Comfortable indoor/outdoor space.  Looks like a dive but is not.  It has caught on with the hip set.  Plus you can drink and dine amidst the ghosts of failed dot com companies.  Hummer Winblad Venture Partners, for example, had their "X-deal happy hour" here in 1999 to coincide with MTV's X-games.
author: Gil S.

description: Last night was so nice I had to find an outdoor place for drinks.  I was sold on the great pics and description of the outdoor patio.  Got there and it was pretty empty of a Friday night...and it was a little grungier than I expected.  I must be the only weirdo that orders wine...they ran out of chardonnay???  Should that be a bar staple?  Anyhow, the dj played some good music and it turned out to be a nice place for some mello drinks and great conversation with a couple friends. :D  And i would totally go back for a low key lazy night.  And yes, during some course of the night I did smell majarauna....
author: Jenny K.

description: Dark and dive-y ... and not packed to the brim.  Not bad.
author: Melinda C.

description:
i think i need to experience this place when its more packed in order to give it a full on review.

i met up with a friend the other day after work. so it was a tuesday around 3:30pm and there were only like 10 people in there.

sweetest thing about this place, especially during the day...outside seating. its cute. and super cozy.

happy hour $4 hefenweizen. niiiiiiiice.

if you just wanna chill go here during happy hour.
good times.
author: A. V.

description: Really dig this place. Outdoor patio, comfortable vibe, good indoor space too. Solid drinks, bartenders, and good bar food. Can't go wrong. Might just be my new favorite place to get drunk.... I mean, my new favorite neighborhood spot.
author: Kristen L.

description: This is the spot right next to my office, so I am a pretty frequent cutomer there. Great menu as is, but with addition of daily special it's even better. Fried chicken, tacos, fish and chips, pasta - something for everyone there, even for the picky eater. Service has always been great and staff is very friendly.
author: Misha K.

description: Nice bar with a nice outdoor area.  I only had beer when I went here for happy hour on a Friday afternoon.  It's not near anything I usually go to, but it seems to be a great place for those who live in SOMA.  Not cheap, but not expensive.  Clean and friendly staff.  Overall a good experience.
author: Corey V.

description: Mars makes most reminisce about the dotcom hey day, when there was no hotter bar. Nish had his birthday there,  some might have danced on the bar in a short skirt, but I was a minor so that record, if there was one is now sealed. Now under new ownership, this is again where you want to have your birthday: a patio for those sunny days, cool staff, a chill crowd. This place is going to keep coming up with ways to entertain (they are getting a live music liscence), but aspiring to be your favorite hang out instead of the next hottest thing burning  out like so much a gas station matchbook.
author: Jean W.

description:
good times are to be had here. 

1) bartenders are super friendly
2) they have good greasy bar food to keep you from puking
3) dj's almost every night of the week
4) happy hour is generally well attended
5) drinks are reasonably priced (for san francisco)
6) heavy pour


.... oh yeah, and the bartenders are nice :) It's worth the trip. Fun space, and nice peeps seem to hang out. Not the typical "I have a startup so f* you" startup peeps.
author: Annie T.

description: Funky, cute lil bar with a mixture of settings that cater to everyone. As Cassio pointed out, there was the outdoor patio, the 80s discoball with Xmas lights dancefloor section with a football game on the flatscreen and there was another bar area where there were tables and chairs and bar stools. So hence, I guess it's a sports bar, cum dance club cum garden experience kinda place!! DJ Raoul's gig was a fun and great time, of course lovely and babylicious Connie was hosting her bday bash out there and seeing many familiar yelpers sum up to an enjoyable evening.
author: Yan M.

description: SWEET ASS PLACE!  Open, great bar, cool pool table/area, running theme of mine is the awesome outdoor patio.  Not to mention the awesome bartenders.  AWESOME BARTENDERS!  Killer juke box, great vibe.  The only thing that sucks about it is the location.  But I will continue to patron this bar for the afore mentioned reasons.  A must stop on every list.
author: Max M.

description:
love you guys! 

great (and by great, I mean, STRONG) very resonably priced drinks

always good music

awesome better than your average bar fare

who can beat Donna Sashay's fried chicken!!

yea outdoor patio!

friendly, fast, bar (& kitchen) staff.

Always a fun time, the atmosphere of being at your house, but with none of the clean up, and all the variety of booze you could desire.

Love ya mars bar happy 3 years! look forward to many, many more!
author: Piper D.

description: The bar is pretty chill.  The bartenders are laid back and cool.  They have food if you're hungry, but nothing special just your average bar food.
author: Heather S.

description: Love it...  This bar is in a quiet part of town, it was very easy to find parking.  We went this past Saturday for a birthday party celebration.  We had the private area and bottle service that made it memorable.  The dj at the beginning was not good, all house music that sounded the same.  Luckily the birthday party folks hired their own dj and he was great, many old school songs with some new school.   Any dj that plays Tupac, Prince and TPain is a favorite of mine.  There was some awesome people watching to do here, lots a folks that should not have been dancing, ha!  The crowd here is super chill, no drama in these parts.  The outdoor patio area is great for smoking and getting fresh air.  I also appreciated that the restroom was clean and convenient.  I will definately be back!
author: La C.

description: Excellent place to start the night or to finish it off with a strong night cap. A good little neighborhood bar and bar keeps are on it.
author: Steve B.

description: In case they didn't tell you, this is my spot. Owned and managed by my gang out back. I wouldn't dare eat food here but we helped make the patio diverse and "cool". Let's not extend invitations and ruin the atmosphere.
author: Bret S.

description:
It's always a good sign when you walk into a place and there is talent at the entrance giving each other booby inspections.
We rolled up to Mars w/ our new found neighbors/pals across the hall in drinking assault formation on a Thu night.
Noticed a lot of the ladies had cowboy hats on, (some sorta theme?)
It's crowded, we follow each other to the back/outdoor area and scout a place to get our drink on.
Back bar is kinda limited in selection, so we make due. (wanted a vanilla stoli and ginger ale, but settled for vanilla rum and sprite)
We score a table for our 8 person? group and good thing we did, as the ppl keep on coming.
Crowd appears like a mix of frisco stereotypes, yuppies, hipsters, cougars, boiler roomers, paris hilton disciples ranging from 25-45
Sexy vibe was cool, drunk ppl, loud music, dancing on the dancefloor, women with open back tops. There is also a lot of hetero and w-w touching going on = good stuff. Drunk french guy touching my arm with his lit cigarette =  bad stuff.
After a few rounds of jello shots in our group, we break out a good ole bar favorite - ice cube clevage basketball. Pillage all the ice out of the drinks on the table, all the girl's shirts are wet ;)
We stumble out of the bar, one of the girls is doing the drunk-look-at-me sidewalk dance, think I counted about 4 camera phones streaming that sh!t right to youtube
Make our way back to the crib, buzzed and feelin' frisky....

Bottom line. Hella good bar, good crowd, conducive to debaucherous behavior, 2 blocks from home
author: G K.

description: Home of one one of my favorite patios in the middle of nowhere.  I went here for a private party with catering and a DJ so I can only reliably review the space and the drinks.  Indoor bar is also very cool, lots of comfy booth seating.  Definitely not a dive, but not dress-up pretentious either.  Laid back in the SOMA - what a find.  Strong drinks and good beer selection.  I'll be back.
author: Jennifer B.

description: Overall, nice space and patio area.  I didn't care so much for the late 90's Top 40 blasting overhead but the place is big enough you can still talk to and hear friends.  Don't be fooled by some of the reviews below.  I was looking for some good happy hour specials, but there's no $1.50 Red Stripe special.  Also, it's really not that divey at all - plenty of suits in the house on a Friday after work.
author: c t.

description: Nice remodel, this place looks a helluva lot better than the last time I was there.  Glad to see the owners have put some money into the killer back patio - I'll have to head over there for brunch sometime soon!!
author: kerry l.

description:
ok, the beer selection is NOT INTERESTING (as other reviewers wrote): big daddy from speakeasy was the only small-ish name; the rest was guinness, sierra nevada, stella, maybe one anchor steam.  meh.  at least the beers cost $4.25 instead of the typical SF $6.

  this place is very SOMA-y: lots of yuppies trying to be hip through loud music and drinking.  so yeah, maybe it's a good place to get drunk, but if you want to actually hear what other ppl are saying (i.e. have a CONVERSATION) you'll need to go outside and even then you still have to yell.  sigh.  i sound so old.
author: Zoe L.

description: I just had my birthday party at Mars (I chose the venue based on Yelp reviews) and it was a huge success! The 40 or so people that showed up all seemed to be having just as fabulous a time as I did, especially since there was something for everyone-drinks, good food, pool table, DJ & dancing, and a big heated patio for the smokers (it was actually almost too warm out there!) Jenny was extremely helpful and accommodating with the arrangements, even booking a DJ for me. The location was great for my guests traveling from the East Bay since it's right off the freeway and there's plenty of street parking. Definitely a great party venue.
author: Sara W.

description: Great after work spot.  Nice set up, nice heated patio area, and the place never gets too crowded.  Bartenders are super friendly... and the bar food here is actually good!
author: Sayeh A.

description:
Ahhh memories!

This is the bar that popped my cherry & led me down a path to my alkie problems. lol. 
My first shots of tequila......
.....and my last.

I used to get so wasted at this place, I can barely even remember what it this place looks like! The last time I was here was 5-6 years ago. Hmm.
author: Sheila S.

description: This place is a real joint hidden in SOMA. The decor included very unsusual paintings. I think one of them was a naked woman now that I think about it.  There is an outdoor patio for smokers, but in SF it's always freezing! Who wants to drink outdoors?  They don't serve girly beers (no cider and no zima) but they do mix a mean mojito. I think the bartender was blitzed. He was dancing all over the place to the music on the speakers and my well drinks were STRONG.  I gave extra points for the awesome 80's music pumping through the place. Everyone sang along to Bon Jovi and Madonna. There is also a cool looking old timey jukebox ( I think it worked.)  And I gave extra points for the kitchen staying open until 10:00. The food was pretty good for bar food.
author: Deanna C.

description: Every now and again the amazing Juanita MORE hosts a super fab fried chicken brunch here!  Last Sunday she hosted an fried chicken Oscar Party...and let me tell you it was amazing!  The chicken recipe is out of this world!
author: Johnnie T.

description:
It's good to see that Mars Bar is one of the few places in the area to be born during the Media Gulch SF internet boom and still be around long after the bust.  

We used to go there as one of the weekend night hotspots in the early 2000s, but lately have been going there on occasion on Fridays after work.  

Mars has a nice little side patio that is nice to sit in when the weather is nice.  As such, it's a nice alternative on nice days when you know that Zeitgest and El Rio are going to be prohibitively crowded.

Service can be a bit spotty, mainly because of their being busy.  My main gripe was that the last time we were there, we had a couple of stoli tonics and they were $8 a piece on a Friday at 5:15 pm.  So much for Happy Hour.  What's worse, the drinks were mixed on the weak side and light on stoli.  And they were not big either, being served in tumblers.  That's kinda an overpriced drink in my book.
author: Dave N.

description: Mar's is my favorite. Christopher, Annalee, Genevieve (I can't mention all of you) love you guys! Thanks for making SF one of my best experience ever!!
author: Doreen W.

description: Friendly and accommodating staff.  I had a birthday/fundraiser at Mars Bar and it was a blast.  Worth checking it out.
author: Lonnie A.

description:
I was invited here to catch up with a friend visiting town and was very pleased.  Parking is easy although the bar could do with a more visible sign, I drove past it twice!
The heated area outside really makes this place, inside it seemed like any other bar, bartenders who ignore you for regulars, sometimes pretentious clientele etc but the patio area seemed much more chilled out and the diversity and nature of those outside seemed to reflect much better on this place.  Ample seating and the heating system is if anything too hot!
author: P H.

description: Good crowd. Friendly staff. Good food. I love their Mar's Burger. Good beer. On a nice sunny day, it's nice to sit outdoors (they have a back patio area). Lots of seating area as well.
author: Sam W.

description: The Macro-Adobe company bar.  Well, not really, but its always weird to me when I see people I don't work with here.
author: Steve S.

description: Still here and still going...great food, excellent cocktails and a patio where you can smoke. Love it...
author: Teddy d.

description: Before I even step foot at Mars my co workers told me it was a dive bar and not to expect anything.  Now I use to work in suburbia where the bars are really fancy and the appetizers were hors d'oeuvres.  I'm glad I didn't expect to much because I actually enjoyed myself.  The garlic fries are so yummmy as well as the buffalo chicken.
author: May A.

description: This bar is cool, cool, coolio! I showed up at around 8pm on a Friday, and it wasn't overly crowded (though I heard it was a little more packed during the height of happy hour). Anyhow, the dirty martinis were flowing and the crowd was lively, but not crazy. The bartender lady was very friendly and had great earrings... gotta love that! This is a good spot for a fun, hip evening without all the madness of other HH spots.
author: Lisa F.

description: Since I seem to be going here a lot, since it's about a block from my girlfriend's place, thought I'd update my review. This place has the cool back patio. Bartendars are great and they serve food. Tuesdays they have 2 dollar Tecates and 2 dollar tacos. My only knock on it was they ran out of Tacos and Tecates. But when the weather is good the back patio is a great place to post up and have a few cold ones.
author: Hyung L.

description: Being so close to the Hall of Justice, you'd think this would be just another uptight lawyer hangout. Nay, my friend. This place is so down to earth, people go back to work with their tie still tucked into their shirt -- you know, between the second and third to top buttons-- not to mention a killer buzz. Uptight? Not guilty!
author: Sang N.

description: i came here for the first time last night for a friends birthday party and it was really cool. Nice decor, big ass backyardpatiotypesituation. If you clog your lungs w tar as I do,thats always a perk.
author: Lauren V.

description: Great SOMA lunch spot.  I recommend it to everyone who asks since SOMA area is so totally devoid.  AND the owner is a hottie but I don't go that way....   Recommend  retro with Mars Burger and a Root Beer Float ... not the kiddy version.
author: D R.

description: Been here a few times for happy hour.  It's a cool place to have a few drinks after work.  The servers are really nice and show up often to see if you need a refill, sometimes before your current drink is even done.  The outside seating is great for summer weather but they also have heaters for the cold days.  I haven't checked out on a Friday or Saturday night but might have to one of these days.  The place is not that big so I imagine it can get packed at times.  Worth checking out at least once if you are in the SOMA area of the city.
author: Paul C.

description: Just held a birthday party here and the staff was great. They hid the Citizen Cake (yum!) in the back for us and even ate the last piece! It seems to get an after work rush, then is quiet later. I would definately throw another party here, but there are places I would go first to cause trouble of a Saturday night...
author: Gretchen T.

description: Always good times. Decent prices for drinks, chill atmosphere, perfect place to shelter from the rain and hang after work.
author: Jessica L.

description: I like the outdoor patio with the heating lamps.  Heating lamps make smokers happy and I smoke when I drink, thefore I'm happy at Mars Bar.  Good vibe as well and I heard they serve up some good food.  Maybe I'll try it next time I hit this place up.
author: Christina S.

description: After reading some reviews, I decided to host my birthday party here on Saturday.  It was the perfect place for a big group.  We basically took over the back area where the pool table/dance floor are.  It was a fun venue for our crowd -- the boys played pool, the girls danced, and we all drank ourselves silly.  Not the best location since it is hard to get to from public transportation.  But, hey, it is much easier to catch a cab here than in the Mission.  The bartenders were great and even offered up a free drink to the birthday girl (Thanks, Todd!).  I don't know how often I would actually come back, but it is definitely a good place to host an event.
author: Katie M.

description: Second time to Mars Bar and its been great both times. Great staff, good music, reasonable prices and a good scene. Not the hipster SF crowd coming in with their bike locks and pant leg rolled up. Food was so so. Jenny was a great waitress.
author: Joe U.

description: their ahi tuna (whether it's a sandwich or a salad) is always legit and you cant beat taco tuesdays. great spot to just unwind after work. oh and their staff is very friendly.
author: Danny K.

description: Like many of the other reviews, I came here for a birthday party and was pleasantly surprised.  The location is pretty industrial and remote, so its not a place you'd just wander into but inside it is pretty nice.  There's a pool table in the back and an outdoor patio.  They also have a DJ mixing a variety of dance/hip-hop music.  It wasn't overly crowded, which made it a good place for a larger gathering or a birthday party.
author: M P.

description:
This is my neighborhood/corner bar--so I'm huge fan based on convenience alone.  :)
But the bar food is also great --they have a KILLER Niman Ranch burger+fries.

Also--have you noticed that they're open Sunday morning/afternoons now--END-UP style!  It's been really fun these last couple weekends since the sun's been out!
author: Amy C.

description: All I know is that it is by flower market/ design center and there is tons of parking.  HOw great is that?  Love it!!  They have a spanking patio in the back, so life is sweet, the bar tenders are super nice, albiet a bit on the loud side, yet if you get there early it is fine.
author: Nicole F.

description: I always have fun at Mars Bar. Cool bartenders, pool table, outdoor seating, and strong drinks!
author: Kris C.

description: i went here for happy hour last night.  It was pretty cool outside, but nice because they have these outdoor heaters that make you feel like your in the sun.  Our food was good and the beers got refilled pretty quickly.  The bartender was pretty cute too and she would come by and touch my shoulder whenever she asked if I needed anything else.  That was nice, but I'm pretty sure she only did that because it helps get better tips.  By the end of the night I was drunk, and this bar is pretty cool.
author: christopher h.

description: This place is loud, the service is a bit slow, the outdoor patio heaters will attempt to bake you, but, damn, that ahi tuna sandwich is way above average bar fare.
author: Maximillian M.

description: This is a fun bar to hit up after work.  A very nice space with an out door patio and tasty bar food.  I look forward to going back soon!
author: David H.

description:
this used to be a hidden gem in SOMA with plenty of parking, tv screens playing 'adult films', an outdoor patio with heatlamps, and a pool table. the best part was the root beer float - a pint size glass of bailey's, root beer, and vanilla stoli. delicious.

but this place has sucked the past few times - once they were playing some sort of trance/electronica music and the bartender didn't know how to make the root beer float (even though it was on the menu!). and the second time they were still playing the bad music, and this time we had to pay a $5 cover charge - when we protested that we had never had to pay before, they said "we provide you with a dj playing great music," by which i have to assume he meant the trance/electronica. 

but i had such a great time the first few times i went, i will still give them four stars.
author: Lisa M.

description: solid bar.  live DJ, nice bartenders, pool table, outdoor patio.  No frills, nothing fancy, no punches pulled.  great for just hanging out!
author: grant l.

description: OK, I am totally biased because I practically live here at Mars and have for years. Over the last 8 years I've seen this place go through so many changes and it still manages to be a great place to hang out. While location (1 block from work) allows me the convenience to frequent the bar as often as I like, its the bartenders, staff, and atmosphere that keeps me coming back. They have a knack for hiring the right kind of people and it really makes this place special.  The outdoor patio and Godzilla sized heat lamp make this a very cozy place. It can get quite crowded, so its best to get there earlier rather than later. If I see you there, and you were there first, I apologize in advance for stealing your chair ;)
author: Tony D.

description: Remember those chocolaty Mars bars with the slogan "A Mars a day helps you work, rest and play"?  It could apply to this Mars bar place too (albeit any bar).  Their long happy hours all week long would definitely help make my work week seem shorter.  The food is decent and people are friendly enough.  However, the jukebox is dysfunctional and expect service to be SLOW.
author: Naomi N.

description:
okay, where do i begin? for me to complain about the type of music they were playing would be unfair because i do have free agency to not go to an establishment that plays annoying house music, BUT i do get to complain about the levels at which they play said house music. if this was just a bar, i'd understand. but they have tables and they serve food. i was already sorta deaf PRIOR to going to the my bloody valentine show. someone should have been giving out earplugs outside of mars!

my gf already touched upon a lot of the major points, but i'll just repeat hers and add one or two new ones. we got a couple of small snacks - a plate of fries, which came with chipotle aioli (tasted nothing like chipotle), and a cheese quesadilla (a rip off at $8.00, by the way). oh yeah and my gf forgot to mention that the girl bussing tables was cleaning off our table and she was stacking our empy glasses and plates and she didn't care to notice my gf was still eating food on one of those plates that she grabbed and stacked. umm, a little common sense?

i was excited to hear they serve margaritas in pint glasses, but to my disappointment they were weak as hell and i could only taste some very bad syrupy margarita mix. which mean't we had to buy 2 shots each of tequila. tiny ass shots too for $9 each? 

so yeah, horrible experience here. not one good thing i have to say about it.
author: James J.

description: Attended a great birthday party here recently. We had a lot of fun.  The staff was exceptional and very helpful.  This was THE after work spot during the dot-com hey day.  Still fun.
author: Todd S.

description: Love this place right behind my house $2 tuesdays is the best spend my day there all the time. Good house music on the weekends too love the crowd there
author: Pedro V.

description: I have only been here for Juanita's parties but the bartenders are always great, the drinks are good and the fried chicken is delicious! I want MORE!
author: David F.

description: Men are from Mars...awesome dj's, cool vibe, one of my old-time favorite bars to go to, especially when I just need to chill...
author: Jordon C.

description:
Like Lisa M., I stumbled on this place while it was still in its hidden gem, pre-dot.com years phase. I have fond memories (as well as great recent experiences) of its drinks, the mixed crowd, the fries, the clams and other eats...and that irresistable but oh-so rare-now-in-SF combo of no attitude folks out to have fun. That's right, fun, actual fun! Had a few CD/CD-ROM release parties here too...

But the cover charge... say it isn't so... cover charges are the first step on the road hell and no fun so let's hope that they go away... and frankly, no offense to their profession, I personally don't think that DJs ADD to the vibe of a cool little place. I much prefer cool mixes from the barkeep/waitstaff and loyal habitues. (If I wanted a 'DJ experience,' I'd go to DNA or whatever. (Okay: I'll be honest here: I almost NEVER want a DJ experience, except at a private party when the DJ is a friend...) 

So I'm minusing one star 'cause of the DJ.
author: caitlin c.

description: Gag. If bad bad bad margaritas with sweet & sour mix in plastic Solo cups is your thing, this is the bar for you.
