Used to be a decent divey local, but now that they pretend like they're hip or something (see their site) they've lost the local charm & gained a trying-too-hard crowd. Go around the corner to Catalyst.
author: Rachel O.

description: We stopped here on our way home from work on a Wed evening for a bite and a drink with the dog in tow.  The pulled pork sando was excellent and the grilled chicken was pretty good.  The onion rings were piping hot and tasty right out of the fryer.  The server was excellent (noticed something wrong with our order and fixed it without us asking) and there was no problem at all with having the dog on the back patio.
author: M T.

description: great place for a beer after work or before a show. 'specially as it's on my way home. the night i went was right before a show across the street, so it was pretty packed. but came on the recommendation of a friend, and he was right. good beers. therefore, it wins!
author: Jeremiah W.

description: Doesn't look like much from the outside...but it's a place to check out for sure.  Lots of parking around there but close enough of a drive from downtown SF.  Laid-back crowd and it's a lot bigger than it appears from the outside.  2 rooms plus an outdoor patio with heat lamps to keep patrons warm and also where you can smoke while having a few drinks!  went there for happy hour and ordered dinner entrees too.  will go back again and again!
author: Mich C.

description: good for happy hour on a friday night after work.  it's a scene and was popular during the dot com days...but they have all the prerequisites for a good basic bar: indoor/outdoor access for all you smokers out there, beer, food, jukebox, and i think i saw a pool table on the other side...not too shabby.
author: Cyn B.

description: This place was reccomended by a friend so I guess you could have fun here.  I was thuroughly dissapointed by the worst drink I've ever had.  It was the weakest most watered down captain and coke.  Not drinkable.  The outdoor patio area was pretty cool though.
author: Laura C.

description: MARS BAR is a good spot to go chill with friends listen to mixed variety of music and have good drinks. We got treated real well by bartenders and he gave us strong drinks. parking is available here since its the only spot in the area. will definitely comeback if i'm in the area looking for a spot with good drinks and not overcrowded.
author: C G.

description: I live around the corner from this place, so it's pretty convenient to go with friends for some drinks and laughs. The food is pretty decent - the pizza is actually really good and the outdoor patio is great. I agree with the other yelpers that it would be fun for a bday!
author: sarah e.

description: Since I started working nearby, this has been my watering hole every Friday afternoon, as well as the occasional week day. Got so much love for this place. Great, friendly staff, good drink specials and an overall fun atmosphere, though sometimes very crowded.
author: Patrick M.

description: Nice patio outside - they keep it warm. The bouncers are a-holes. There is a pool table and lots of drunk bachelorettes. Tight bar, might be hard to get drinks on a busy night.. this place can turn into a sweet party on the right night.
author: David F.

description: The place seems alright. I just went there because they have outdoor seating and I wanted to try their ahi tuna salad, which was good. I love bars that serve decent seafood dishes.
author: John B.

description: Yay for wacky, grungy bars. Decent beer. Diverse crowd. Great music selection. (Didn't try any food, though).
author: Paul W.

description: Excellent venue for after work and amazing for throwing parties. There is no room fee and the staff is excellent. strongly recommended for a chilled out great time
author: Piper P.

description: Great food & drink, friendly staff.  Good for a casual lunch.  Last time I was there in the evening though it wasn't the best place for conversation due to the music.
author: Frank Q.

description: really good bar food, reasonably priced drinks, nice outdoor area, not too crowded, easy parking, good for groups.
author: Caitlin G.
